Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, related field or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of experience with ASIC development.
2 years of experience in a project management (or equivalent) role for the development of hardware or software systems in a cross-functional, cross-organizational context.
preferred_qual:
Master's or PhD degree in Engineering.
Experience as an engineer in developing hardware or software systems and experience with chip development.
Experience with ASIC methodologies, IP design, and leading tapeouts.
Track record of successful execution within resource and schedule constraints.
Ability to motivate and focus a large collaboration to reach challenging goals.
Outstanding communication and facilitation skills.
responsibilities:
Plan, coordinate and deliver platforms hardware products.
Lead the creation and maintaining of credible and data-driven schedules and milestones.
Engage in technical and schedule tradeoff discussions.
Manage teams through design, development, test, manufacturing, deployment and sustaining activities for hardware products.
Collaborate with Engineering and Operations teams to understand requirements and articulate the value proposition of engineering projects.

title: Technical Program Manager, Cloud Online Experience
minimum_qual:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, a related technical field or equivalent practical experience.
4 years of experience in program or project management.
Experience coding in HTML, CSS, Django, JavaScript, and/or Python and build tools.
Experience in site content migration strategy and implementation.
preferred_qual:
Experience with the Google software development stack, tools and processes.

Clarify medium/high complex undefined solutions to help identify and deliver positive impact to the business.
Handle significant ambiguity with emerging business strategy.
Develop and optimize processes and supporting workflows to automate processes for software development, release and access control.
Manage software releases, configuration and infrastructure changes to production.

title: Lead ASIC Verification Engineer, Machine Learning Accelerators
minimum_qual:
Masters degree in Electrical Engineering or, equivalent practical experience.
8 years of relevant work experience.
Experience in the verification of designs such as CPUs, accelerator IPs or peripheral IPs and experience with verification methodologies such as UVM/OVM/VMM.
Experience with SystemVerilog, SVA and functional coverage.
preferred_qual:
Experience in a procedural programming language (e.g., C++, Python, Go).
Experienced in the full verification lifecycle.
Experience with industry-standard simulators, revision control systems and regression systems.
responsibilities:
Plan the verification of complex digital design blocks by fully understanding the design specification. Interact with Design Engineers to identify important verification scenarios.
Create and enhance constrained-random verification environments using SystemVerilog and UVM, or formally verify designs with SVA and industry leading formal tools.
Identify and write all types of coverage measures for stimulus and corner-cases.
Debug tests with Design Engineers to deliver functionally correct design blocks and close coverage measures to identify verification holes and to show progress towards tape-out. Debug, run and measure performance on end to end machine learning workloads.
Work closely with SDK, system, and software teams to ensure tight integration with Google’s software stack.

title: Centralized Procurement Manager, Google Hardware
minimum_qual:
Bachelor's degree in a technical, quantitative, business field or equivalent practical experience.
4 years of experience in technical procurement, commodity management, supply chain management, technical sales, technical business development, and/or services procurement.
Experience with writing, drafting, and negotiating agreements.
Experience working in an industry associated with technology.
preferred_qual:
7 years of experience in commodity, supply chain and/or supplier management.
Experience with the licensing and procurement of technical services, solutions and software.
Exposure to product cycle management in a high-tech industry.
Demonstrated interpersonal, communication and consultation skills.
responsibilities:
Manage business agreements, and optimize methodologies across procurement categories and sub-categories. Manage multiple partners and agreements simultaneously across categories and lead the agreement process.
Oversee, drive and manage external partnerships with an emphasis on consultation of terms and conditions. Act as an escalation point for procurement issues, and be a centralized function for agreements between Engineering, Finance, and Legal teams and the partner.
Develop procurement strategies with defined plans for cost savings, risk assessment and mitigation, and roadmap planning agreements. Address all areas of supplier relationships, pricing analysis, agreement drafting and procurement support.
Write, process, and manage agreements that support the procurement of technical engineering services, equipment, and software and technology licensing. Work with stakeholders to understand future needs for each procurement category, communicate strategy internally, and create a list of approved vendors.
Identify opportunities for streamlining partner engagements and procurement process through partnership strategies, and reduce agreement processing time. Unify processes for strategy efforts across the team and globally.

PhD in Computer Science.
Research work experience.
Experience in recommender systems, natural language understanding, dialog state tracking and/or reinforcement learning.
Ability to design and execute on research agendas.
responsibilities: Focus on conversational approaches to recommendation, in settings where you are interacting with a recommendation system by voice-only or chat.

title: ASIC/SoC Physical Verification and Convergence Engineer
minimum_qual:

Tapeout experience in cutting edge technology nodes.

responsibilities:
Drive the overall sign-off physical convergence for high performance designs.
Define the overall physical convergence methodology, plan out the timeline, and work closely with the block owners to achieve physical convergence through systematic fixes and minimal manual effort.

preferred_qual:

responsibilities:

Edit, clarify, and proofread documents written by others, and coach non-writers on ways to improve their writing skills.
Manage complex documentation projects.
Supplement developer documentation with relevant sample code.

title: Embedded Software Engineer, Sensor, Google Pixel
location: Xindian District, New Taipei City, Taiwan
minimum_qual:
Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science or relevant technical field or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of work experience in integrating and evaluating various sensor modalities(e.g., Accelerometer, Magnetic, Gyroscope, Proximity and Light etc.).
preferred_qual:
PhD or Master's degree in Electrical Engineering or Computer Science or equivalent practical experience.
Experience programming in C, C++, script. Android programming experience.
Hands-on experience in signal processing, micro-controller selection and various digital communication protocols and interfaces (e.g., GPIO, SPI, I2C and UART).
Background in software development. Demonstrated understanding of key concepts in computer architecture.
Familiar with sensor core architecture with demonstrated expertise in implementing sensor fusion algorithms. Knowledge of estimation theory (Kalman Filters, EKF, etc.), hardware performance monitors and profiling.
Understanding of OS tools and Unix internal knowledge. Ability to learn shell scripts, file system operations, and process management.
responsibilities:
Develop the software stack for Pixel devices.
Work with SoC architects, chip vendor and Hardware teams to co-design future mobile systems.
Work on new devices, chips, and architectures to improve sensor accuracy, power and user experience.
Design and develop technologies to simplify the verification and installation of software.
Present new ways to improve the manufacturability and testability of our software while maintaining ease of use and improving the quality of the end user experience.

title: Web Solutions Engineer, Front End Development

title: Infrastructure Engineer, Cloud Professional Services
minimum_qual:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.

responsibilities:

Travel up to 30% of the time within the region for meetings, technical reviews and onsite delivery activities.

title: Technical Solutions Engineer, Google Cloud Platform
minimum_qual:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, related technical field or equivalent practical experience.
2 years of industry experience in technical support, professional services, software development, or product operations management.
Experience with one or more of the following programming/scripting languages: Java, C, C++, .NET, Python, Shell, Perl, JavaScript.
preferred_qual:
Experience with any of cloud storage solutions, SQL database administration, Google App Engine, open source software communities, Cloud networking solutions, or distributed computing technology.
Understanding of basic web technologies (HTTP, HTML, DNS, TCP, etc.).
Network administration skills with understanding of Linux/Unix or Windows system administration (from kernel to shell and beyond, taking in system libraries, file systems and client-server protocols along the way).
Outstanding troubleshooting, attention to detail, and resourcefulness in a fast paced client facing work environment, while demonstrating strong communication skills (both verbal and written).
responsibilities:
Diagnose and resolve customer problems for Google Cloud Platform products; design and implement new operations, productivity and investigation tools to increase efficiency for Technical Solutions Engineering.
Act as a consultant and subject matter expert for key stakeholders in the engineering, business, and customer organizations to resolve technical deployment obstacles and improve the product's vision.
Obtain and maintain an in-depth understanding of Google's product technology and underlying hardware and software architectures; build in-product self-service solutions.
Work closely with multiple product and engineering teams on understanding ways to improve the product and interact with our Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) teams to drive production excellence.
Advocate for our customers by representing their issues to Product Management and Software Engineering and develop innovative ways to resolve issues.

Excellent interpersonal and communication skills; strong analytical skills and a demonstrable bias toward action.
responsibilities:
Develop and deploy applications that support and change fundamental assumptions of how IT works.
Partner with internal teams to define and implement solutions that improve internal business processes.
Work closely with analysts to translate business requirements into technical solutions.
Build internal solutions, with custom front-ends (web, mobile) and back-end services that automate business processes. Integrate third party products into internal systems as well as support and upgrade implemented systems.

title: Technical Solutions Engineer, Google Cloud Platform
minimum_qual:
BA/BS degree in Computer Science or related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
Experience with troubleshooting in a fast paced client facing work environment.
Industry (or relevant) experience in technical support, professional services, software development, or product operations management.
Experience with programming/scripting (i.e. one or more of the following: Java, C, C++, .NET, Python, Shell, Perl, JavaScript).
preferred_qual:

Demonstrated attention to detail and resourcefulness, while demonstrating developed communication skills.

Diagnose and resolve customer problems for Google Cloud Platform products. Design and implement new operations, productivity and investigation tools to increase efficiency for Technical Solutions Engineering.

Obtain and maintain an in-depth understanding of Google's product technology and underlying hardware and software architectures, to build in-product self-service solutions.
Work closely with multiple product and engineering teams on understanding ways to improve the product, and interact with our Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) teams to drive production excellence.

minimum_qual:

title: Infrastructure Cloud Consultant
minimum_qual:
Bachelor's degree in a technical or engineering field or equivalent practical experience.

title: UX Engineer, Front End
minimum_qual:
BA/BS degree in Computer Science, HCI, Design, or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of work experience, including programming experience in C/C++ and/ or Java.
Experience with web technologies (object-oriented JavaScript, HTML, CSS), and experience with the latest web standards including HTML5 and CSS3.
Experience designing and implementing complex UIs.
preferred_qual:
Experience with modern JavaScript frameworks (such as Backbone, Angular, or Ember) and CSS pre-processing frameworks (such as Sass or Less).
Experience with a scripting language, such as Python, Ruby, etc.
Experience with and a passion for user-interface design.
Strong sense of web design and attuned to the fundamentals of user experience, including accessibility.
Ability to communicate to all levels of users (internal and external), strong problem-solving skills, adaptable, proactive and willing to take ownership.
responsibilities:
Work closely with UX designers, project managers and back-end engineers to implement versatile front-end solutions to tricky web development issues.
Embrace emerging standards while promoting best practices in order to push the limits of what a browser can do.
Manage your own time, and work well both independently and as part of a team.
Launch, iterate and make a difference. Provide front-end coding expertise, and be ready to make our products better for our users.
Design and develop the front ends of user facing products.

title: Security Engineer, Infrastructure Protection
minimum_qual:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
Coding experience in one or more general purpose languages.
Experience with attacks and mitigation methods. Experience working in two or more of the following: Network protocols and secure network design; Operating system internals and hardening (e.g. Windows, Linux, OS X, Android); Web application and browser security; Security assessments and penetration testing; Authentication and access control; Applied cryptography and security protocols; Security monitoring and intrusion detection, Incident response and forensics; Development of security tools, automation, or frameworks.
Must have work authorization in Australia.
preferred_qual:
Master's degree in Computer Science or related field.
3 years of relevant work experience in security.
responsibilities:
Design infrastructure and drive its implementation to protect Google networks and systems.
Provide security expertise and guidance to a diverse set of Google engineering and business teams.
Conduct security reviews of core corporate and production infrastructure.
Drive enterprise focused security improvements to Google products and services.
Build security tools and processes for critical infrastructure protection, monitoring and remediation.

title: Lead Application Engineer, Corporate Engineering
minimum_qual:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, related technical field or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of experience implementing and integrating with third-party software through full system implementation life-cycles (i.e., analyze, design, build, test, implement, support).
Experience with one or more general purpose programming languages including but not limited to: Java, Javascript or Python.
Experience in information management, data modeling, system integration, development methodologies and unit testing.
preferred_qual:
Knowledge of third-party systems and business domain.
Ability to perform end-to-end application development and manage an entire app (i.e, build the front end, middle tier, storage, and integration points).
Ability to respectfully review code under firm guidelines and be a mentor with excellent leadership skills.
Ability to break down problems independently wit excellent problem-solving skills.
Passion for code quality.
responsibilities:
Lead the US developer team and build collaboration with our existing Europe, the Middle East and Africa (EMEA) team.
Partner with internal teams to define and implement solutions that improve internal business processes. Integrate third-party products into internal systems and support and further evolve existing systems.
Maintain high levels of development practices including technical design, solution development, systems configuration, documentation, test, issue identification and resolution, writing clean, modular and self-sustaining code.
Work directly with the people who use our products.
Work closely with analysts to translate business requirements into technical solutions.

title: Developer Advocate, G Suite
minimum_qual:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a similar technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
4 years of software engineering or development experience.
2 years of coding experience in two of the following languages: Java, C/C++, C#, Objective-C, Python, JavaScript, PHP, Ruby or Go.
Experience working directly with partners or third-party developers. Experience presenting at technology conferences, hack-a-thons, webinars, blogging/writing technical articles with an existing follower base or contributing to an open source project for new and existing technologies and/or programming languages.
preferred_qual:
Master's degree in Computer Science.
5 years of software engineering or development experience.
5 years of recent coding experience in two or more of the following languages: Java, C/C++, C#, Objective-C, Python, JavaScript, PHP, Ruby or Go.
Experience as a software developer, architect, technical evangelist, consultant, community manager, product manager, CTO or consultant working with various platforms.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the desire to share technical knowledge and information with others which includes experience working directly with press/bloggers.
responsibilities:
Define developer narratives and do both online and in-person outreach for Google's G Suite products.
Create momentum and drive the success of the G Suite Developer Platform through your knowledge of, and interactions with, key third-party technical communities.
Promote G Suite developer products in-person and online by presenting at conferences, blogging, creating videos, writing technical tutorials and other similar activities.
Advocate for your community internally, influence G Suite product strategy and craft narratives around new products and features by working with Product Management, Engineering, PR, Marketing, Business Development and other cross-functional teams.
Build and foster an external 'community ecosystem' of influencers, meet-ups and experts that amplify our messages and extend our reach.

title: Cloud DevOps and Infrastructure Engineer, Google Professional Services
minimum_qual:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
Experience serving in the capacity of a Technical Consultant or Advisor, or equivalent client-facing engineering experience.
Experience in maintaining Internet facing production-grade applications in cloud environments and hands on experience in one or more programming languages (e.g., C#, C++, C, Java, Go, or Python).
Ability to travel up to 30% of the time.
preferred_qual:
Experience with scalable networking technologies (e.g. Load Balancers, Firewalls, etc.) and web standards (e.g. REST APIs, web security mechanisms, etc)
Experience with software deployment and orchestration technologies (e.g. Puppet, Chef, Salt, Ansible, Docker, Kubernetes, Mesos, OpenStack, Jenkins, etc)
Experience supporting transactional database systems (e.g. MySQL, PostgreSQL, MongoDB and/or Cassandra, etc)
Experience in standard IT security practices (e.g., encryption, certificates, key management).
Experience in troubleshooting and system administration tasks in Linux, Unix or Windows.
responsibilities:
Be a trusted technical advisor to customers and solve complex Cloud Infrastructure and DevOps challenges.
Create and deliver best practices recommendations, tutorials, blog articles, sample code, and technical presentations adapting to different levels of key business and technical stakeholders.
Provide highly technical implementation support in customer environment, including guidance on implementation feasibility of cross-product integrations.
Travel up to 30% of time to in-region for meetings, technical reviews, and onsite delivery activities.

title: Software Engineer, Machine Learning
minimum_qual:
BA/BS degree in Computer Science or related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
1 year of work or educational experience in Machine Learning or Artificial Intelligence.
Experience with one or more general purpose programming languages including: Java, C/C++ or Python.
1 year relevant work experience in software development.
preferred_qual: Experience with one or more of the following: Natural Language Processing, text understanding, classification, pattern recognition, recommendation systems, targeting systems, ranking systems or similar.
responsibilities:
Participate in cutting edge research in artificial intelligence and machine learning applications.
Develop solutions for real world, large-scale problems.

title: Sensor Test Engineer, Consumer Hardware
minimum_qual:
Bachelor's degree in Engineering, related field or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of experience testing products for manufacturing.
Experience coding in C and Python.
Experience building and launching consumer electronics products. Experience with hardware testing, system bring up and design validation.
preferred_qual:
Experience supporting FATP lines shipping high volume consumer audio products.
Experience in development and integration of sensor modules (touch, MEMS, haptics, ALS) into consumer hardware products.
Experience in debugging, troubleshooting and failure analysis investigation of typical sensor fail modes (e.g., MEMS stiction, drift, touch failures).
Experience designing robust test fixtures and sensor test and calibration software suitable for high-volume manufacturing.
Knowledge of sensor calibration methodologies, including development of test instrumentation, data acquisition and analysis.
responsibilities:
Develop complete test solutions across the product lifecycle for functional and parametric validation of device sensor performance. Manage device testing at system level (end-to-end assembly), mechanical level (all mechanical assemblies) and SMT.
Collaborate with Design/Engineering teams to design product specifications and implement validation. Manage test software development, fixture design and development, system integration and implementation.
Provide feedback and solutions to cross-functional Engineering and Operations teams. Make recommendations to design and test coverage improvement.
Perform parametric data collection and correlation to improve yield and serve as point of contact for Software Engineering teams. Drive potential test gaps and correlation issues between Google and vendors manufacturing processes.
Work with the Engineering team to define test coverage and test fixture requirements. Conduct maintenance of all factory test stations including (production) test stations before/after testing.

title: Developer Advocate, Cloud DevOps
minimum_qual:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, or a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in one or more of the following areas: DevOps, Cloud Native, Cloud Native Ops, SRE, Continuous Delivery, Networking, Config Management, Infrastructure as Code, Operations, IT Admin, Software Automation.
Experience in developing or delivering software, including coding experience in one or more of the following languages: Java, Python, C#, Go, JavaScript, Ruby, PHP, Swift or C/C++.
preferred_qual:
Experience participating in, and advocating on behalf of, external tech communities in order to drive awareness and to help build better products and experiences for these audiences through gathering feedback, sentiment and input as part of design processes.
Demonstrated interest in advocating on behalf of technology communities, and in working with those communities to solve their problems using Google technologies.
responsibilities:
Create momentum and drive the success of Google Cloud Platform (GCP) through your knowledge of, and interactions with, key third-party technical communities.
Advocate for Google Cloud products in-person and online through activities including presenting at conferences, blogging, creating videos and writing technical tutorials.
Advocate internally and influence Google Cloud product strategy by working with Product Management, Engineering, PR, Marketing, Business Development and other cross-functional teams.
Work with Product, Engineering and Marketing teams to define product strategies, to craft narratives and to build demos around new and existing products and features.

minimum_qual:
BS degree in Engineering or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of experience in testing products for manufacturing.
Experience with building and launching consumer electronics products.
Coding experience in Python or C++.
preferred_qual:
MS/PhD in Engineering.
Experience in debug, troubleshooting, and failure analysis investigation.
Experience with hardware testing, system bring-up, and design validation.
Experience working with original equipment manufacturer (OEM) partners.
Mechanical and Software expertise in test station development.

title: Cloud Partner Integration Engineer
minimum_qual:
BA/BS degree in Computer Science or a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
2 years of industry experience in technical support, professional services, engineering, sustaining engineering or systems engineering.

Develop and deliver a complete product to partners and plan for support and maintainability.

title: Cloud Partner Integration Engineer
minimum_qual:
BA/BS degree in Computer Science or a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
2 years of industry experience in technical support, professional services, engineering, sustaining engineering or systems engineering.
Experience with one or more general purpose programming languages including but not limited to: C/C++, Python, Java, or Go.
preferred_qual:
MS or PhD degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or related field or 5 years of industry experience.
Experience developing applications with Java, Python, NodeJS, or Go.
Solid understanding of public cloud systems.
Understanding of Unix/Linux or Windows systems from kernel to shell, system libraries, file systems and client-server protocols.
Strong understanding of web development protocols (i.e. HTML5, AJAX, XML, JSON, RFCs 2109/2965, 1945/2616).
Strong network administration and troubleshooting skills.
responsibilities:
Understand GCP and G Suite partner integration use cases and scenarios, and distill these into product requirements. Define the experience that would realize these requirements.
Develop and deliver a complete product to partners and plan for support and maintainability.
Obtain and maintain an in-depth understanding of Google's product technology and underlying hardware and software architectures, to build integrations with third party software.

title: Technical Solutions Engineer, Google Cloud Platform (English)
minimum_qual:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
2 years of industry experience in technical support, professional services, engineering, sustaining engineering or systems engineering.
Ability to speak and write in English fluently and idiomatically.
preferred_qual:
Experience with cloud storage solutions, SQL database administration, Google App Engine, cloud networking solutions and/or distributed computing technology.
Understanding of basic web technologies (HTTP, HTML, DNS, TCP, etc.).
Familiarity with one or more of the following programming/scripting languages: Java, C, C++, .NET, Go, Python, Shell, Perl, JavaScript.
Network administration skills, with understanding of Linux/Unix or Windows system administration (from kernel to shell and beyond, taking in system libraries, file systems and client-server protocols).
Excellent troubleshooting, attention to detail, and resourcefulness in a fast-paced client-facing work environment, with demonstrated communication skills (both verbal and written).
Ability to speak and write in Japanese, Chinese and/or Korean fluently and idiomatically.
responsibilities:
Diagnose and resolve customer problems for Google Cloud Platform products. Engineer and implement new operations, productivity and investigation tools to increase efficiency for Technical Solutions Engineering.
Act as a consultant and subject matter expert for Product Managers, Software Engineering teams, Sales Engineers, Site Reliability Engineers, and Strategic Customer Engineers to resolve technical deployment obstacles and to improve the product's vision.
Obtain and maintain an in-depth understanding of Google's product technology and underlying hardware and software architectures in order to build in-product self-service solutions.
Work closely with Product Management and Software Engineering teams on understanding ways to improve the product, and interact with our Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) teams to drive production excellence.
Advocate for our customers by representing their issues to Product Management and Software Engineering and develop innovative ways to resolve issues.

title: Software Engineer, Site Reliability Engineering
minimum_qual:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
3 years of experience working with algorithms, data structures, complexity analysis and software design.
Experience in one or more of the following: C, C++, Java, Python, Go, Perl or Ruby.
preferred_qual:
Systematic problem-solving approach, coupled with effective communication skills and a sense of ownership and drive.
Interest in designing, analyzing and troubleshooting large-scale distributed systems.
Ability to debug and optimize code and automate routine tasks.
responsibilities:
Engage in and improve the whole lifecycle of services—from inception and design, through deployment, operation and refinement.
Support services before they go live through activities such as system design consulting, developing software platforms and frameworks, capacity planning and launch reviews.
Maintain services once they are live by measuring and monitoring availability, latency and overall system health.
Scale systems sustainably through mechanisms like automation, and evolve systems by pushing for changes that improve reliability and velocity.
Practice sustainable incident response and blameless postmortems.

title: Web Solutions Engineer, Product and Tools Operations
minimum_qual:
BS degree in Computer Science or related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of overall software engineering or development experience in at least two of the following languages - Java, HTML5, Python, Go, C++ or JavaScript.
Experience in network and/or Linux system administration and troubleshooting.
preferred_qual:
Extensive experience with one or more of: HTML, CSS, JavaScript
Highly proficient in multiple programming languages, including Java, JavaScript, Typescript or Python
A passion for engineering excellence and ample experience with unit testing, agile project development, and bug and change management systems
Ability to quickly and independently provide technical solutions to business problems
Demonstrated ability to be flexible/adaptable in exercising judgment in a dynamic environment and able to manage competing priorities and deadlines
responsibilities:
Design, build, and deploy scalable software platforms for teams within gTech.
Ensure that all technical solutions are designed in a way that enable other analytical teams to easily access data for operational reporting and data visualization.
Collaborate with product engineers to enhance core platforms and create applications using standard and Google-specific software development tools.
Write and review technical documents, including design, development, revision documents and review code in compiled or scripted languages.
Analyze, review, and modify programs to increase operating efficiency or meet new requirements as well as execute testing, debugging, maintenance and/or program updates.

title: Developer Advocate, Data Science and Analytics
minimum_qual:
BA/BS degree in Computer Science or a similar technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of software engineering or development experience, with coding experience in Java, Python and/or R, or experience working with SQL.
Experience working with data analytics and/or data science technologies with on-premise and/or cloud technologies data.
preferred_qual:
Experience working directly with customers, partners or third party developers, and advocating or mentoring for new and existing technologies and programming languages.
Experience within one or more of the following verticals: retailing, media and entertainment, sports, gaming, financial services and/or higher education.
responsibilities:
Identify opportunities of adoption for Google Cloud technologies within specified verticals in the use case domain of data analytics and data science.
Create plans and initiatives that create momentum and lead the success of Google Cloud Platform through your knowledge of, and interactions with key third-party technical communities and key customers.
Consult on and advocate during customer adoption engagements to ensure optimal execution of the opportunity e.g. strategy ideation, POC development, production implementation.
Advocate for developer communities internally, and influence Google Cloud product strategy and craft narratives around new products and features by working with cross-functional teams.
Build and foster an external ‘community ecosystem’ of influencers, meetups, experts that amplify our messages and extend our reach.

title: Cloud Data Engineer, Google Cloud Professional Services
minimum_qual:
Bachelor's degree in a technical or engineering field or equivalent practical experience.
Programming experience in one or more of the following: Java, Python, JavaScript, NodeJS, C#, NET, Ruby.
Experience with database design and querying (e.g., SQL, MySQL, MapReduce, Hadoop).
Experience in Big Data within the cloud, including data analytics and data warehousing.
preferred_qual:
Experience with open source software such as Cassandra, MongoDB, RabbitMQ and enterprise Content Management or Business Applications (CRM, ERP, etc.).
Experience in Google Cloud Platform and/or other public cloud products.
Technical experience in Web technologies such as HTML, XML, JSON, OAuth 2 along with experience in analysis of relational data in MySQL, Google BigQuery or similar.
Knowledge of solution architecture within web and mobile environments, web/internet related technologies, architecture across Software-as-a-Service, Platform-as-a-Service, Infrastructure-as-a-Service (SAAS, PAAS, IAAS) and cloud productivity suites.
Ability to work effectively and influence stakeholders on internal and external engineering teams, product development teams, sales operations teams as well as external partners and consumers.
Excellent presentation and communication skills.
responsibilities:
Consult with customers on technical challenges based on in-depth product and technical knowledge.
Develop technical tools and documentation to expedite implementations and improve product serviceability.
Act as a liaison for the Engineering and Product teams to commercialize solutions with partners and customers.
Provide product solution improvements and market opportunities to Product Managers and Engineering.
Provide highly technical implementation support in customer environment, including guidance on implementation feasibility of cross-product integrations.

title: Public Sector Infrastructure Cloud Consultant
minimum_qual:
Bachelor's degree in a technical or engineering field or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of experience in the public sector, building, supporting, or migrating applications (e.g., experience in cloud technical program management and/or cloud solution architecture).
Experience reading software code in one or more languages such as Java, JavaScript and Python.
Ability to travel up to 30% of the time.
preferred_qual:
Master's degree in a technical or engineering field.
10 years of experience in software systems design, with experience in architecting distributed systems.
Experience in architecting, developing and/or maintaining production-grade systems.
Experience in virtualization, multi-tenant cloud infrastructures, storage systems and content delivery networks.
Understanding of the current state of infrastructure automation, continuous integration/deployment, SQL/NoSQL, containers, security, networking, and cloud-based delivery models.
Ability to translate business requirements into technology solution with excellent project management, presentation, and communication skills.
responsibilities:
Interact with sales/partner leads and technical stakeholders to translate complex customer requirements into recommendations for solution architectures and consulting services.
Work with a team of technical consultants, provide a point of escalation for customer inquiries, coach and grow team members' skills in consulting delivery.
Work with customer technical leads, client executives, and partners to manage and deliver migrations to cloud solutions.
Work closely with Product and Engineering teams to package best practices and lessons learned into thought leadership, methodologies and published assets.
Understand and clearly articulate customer needs, and help shape Google’s long-term product strategy. Be an advocate of Google’s product innovation story.

minimum_qual:
Experience in HTML, JavaScript and CSS.

preferred_qual:
Ability to design large-scale distributed systems.

responsibilities:
Create innovative web services, from elegant JavaScript contraptions all the way to large-scale data acquisition and processing.
Manage availability, latency, scalability and efficiency of Google services by engineering reliability into software and systems.
Respond to and resolve emergent service problems. Write software and build automation to prevent problem recurrence.

title: Cloud DevOps and Infrastructure Engineer, Google Professional Services
minimum_qual:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
Experience serving in the capacity of a Technical Consultant or Advisor, or equivalent client-facing engineering experience.
Experience in maintaining Internet facing production-grade applications in cloud environments and hands on experience in one or more programming languages (e.g., C#, C++, C, Java, Go, or Python).
Ability to travel up to 30% of the time.
preferred_qual:
Experience with scalable networking technologies (e.g., Load Balancers, Firewalls, etc.) and web standards (e.g., REST APIs, web security mechanisms, etc.).
Experience with software deployment and orchestration technologies (e.g., Puppet, Chef, Salt, Ansible, Docker, Kubernetes, Mesos, OpenStack, Jenkins, etc)
Experience supporting transactional database systems (e.g. MySQL, PostgreSQL, MongoDB and/or Cassandra, etc.).
Experience in standard IT security practices (e.g., encryption, certificates, key management).
Experience in troubleshooting and system administration tasks in Linux, Unix or Windows.
responsibilities:
Be a technical advisor to customers and solve complex Cloud Infrastructure and DevOps challenges.
Create and deliver best practices recommendations, tutorials, blog articles, sample code, and technical presentations adapting to different levels of key business and technical stakeholders.
Provide highly technical implementation support in customer environment, including guidance on implementation feasibility of cross-product integrations.
Travel up to 30% of time to in-region for meetings, technical reviews, and onsite delivery activities.

title: Engineering Resident, University Graduate (Fixed-Term Employee)
minimum_qual:
Completion of BA/BS degree in Computer Science, related technical field of study or equivalent practical experience, including computer science coursework, no later than August 2019
Programming experience in one or more of the following general purpose programming languages: C/C++, C# Java, Javascript, Python, or Go
Authorization to legally work in the United States
preferred_qual:
Experience with data structures, algorithms, or complexity analysis (i.e. completing coursework, course projects, research, individual projects, internships, or other practical experience in/outside of school or work)
Relevant experience, open source contributions or competitive programming exposure through hands on coding in a general purpose programming language
Interest and ability to learn in a team environment with a focus on knowledge sharing and collaboration
Strong communication skills, including working proficiency and communication skills in verbal and written English.
responsibilities:
Participate in an initial training period, which lasts eight weeks. Engineering Residency combines interactive group learning with training on Google tools, technologies and best practices.
Following the training period, residents are placed in two 4.5 month rotations. During the rotational period, residents are embedded on Engineering teams across the company. They work side-by-side with engineers on projects that are core to Google.
Work on specific projects critical to Google’s business needs based on your technical experience. These opportunities exist across multiple groups within Google.
Be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to handle new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward in all areas.

title: Cloud DevOps and Infrastructure Engineer, Google Professional Services
minimum_qual:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, related technical field or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in writing software in one or more languages, such as Java, Python, Go, JavaScript, C++ or similar.
Experience maintaining internet facing production-grade applications in virtualized environments (cloud computing platforms and services). Experience managing internal or client-facing projects, troubleshooting clients' technical issues and working with engineering, sales and services teams and customers.
Ability to travel 30% of the time as required.
preferred_qual:
Experience working with scalable networking technologies such as Load Balancers/Firewalls and web standards (REST APIs, web security mechanisms).
Experience working with deployment and orchestration technologies (such as Docker, Kubernetes, Mesos, OpenStack, Puppet, Chef, Salt, Ansible, Jenkins).
Understanding of open source server software (such as NGINX, RabbitMQ, Redis, Elasticsearch).
Familiarity with standard IT security practices such as encryption, certificates and key management.
responsibilities:
Act as a trusted technical advisor to customers and solve complex Google Cloud Infrastructure and DevOps challenges.
Create and deliver best practices recommendations, tutorials, blog articles, sample code, and technical presentations adapting to different levels of key business and technical stakeholders.
Ability to travel 30% of the time as required.
Communicate effectively via video conferencing for meetings, technical reviews and onsite delivery activities.

System validation and optimization experience in one or more of the following areas: high-speed serial interface (MIPI/DP/HDMI/USB/PCIe), memory interface (LPDDR3/LPDDR4), RF validation (Wi-Fi, Bluetooth), power supply (switch mode power supply, LDO), EMC/ESD/Safety compliance, display, camera (optical and electrical), audio, sensors, and input devices (capacitive touch, keyboard, mouse, etc).
preferred_qual:
Master's degree in Electrical Engineering or Computer Engineering.
6 years of industry experience in electronic test and design validation.
Experience with high volume consumer product design and development, with a focus on signal integrity, power integrity, RF, desense, and/or EMC/EMI/ESD.
Experience in one or more of the following areas: validation of computer I/Os (USB, HDMI, DisplayPort, etc.), RF validation (Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, Cellular), Display, Camera validation (optical and electrical), Audio validation (microphone and speaker quality), input device validation (capacitive touch, keyboard, mice, etc.).
Experience in software programming for lab test automation within a Linux environment using Python, Perl, Tcl, MATLAB, LabVIEW, and/or C++.
Experience in simulation and lab correlation in both frequency domain and time domain using commercial tools, such as PowerSI, PowerDC, OptimizePI, SIwave, and/or HSPICE.
responsibilities:
Manage overall hardware system validation and quality optimization for consumer hardware products.
Author test plans with the goal of catching issues and fixing them at early design stage in order to improve the overall product quality and meet associated schedules.
Execute validation tests in the lab and oversee execution of tasks assigned to external vendors.
Collaborate with other engineers on system bring-up, design verification, troubleshooting, failure analysis and design optimization. Resolve issues, implement corrective actions, and improve system performance.
Work with internal test engineers, partner engineers, and contract manufacturers on transitioning product to mass production, and assist with product sustaining efforts.

title: Technical Solutions Engineer, Chrome and Android, Google Cloud

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related technical field or equivalent practical experience.

Excellent network administration and troubleshooting skills with an understanding of Linux/Unix system administration and knowledge of Web and Mail-related standards, such as HTTP, HTML, XML, cookie-based SSO, and SMTP.

BS degree in Computer Science or related technical field involving systems engineering (e.g., physics or mathematics), or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in one or more of the following: C, C++, Java, Python, Go, Perl, Ruby or shell scripting.
Experience with Unix/Linux operating systems internals and administration (e.g., filesystems, inodes, system calls) or networking (e.g., TCP/IP, routing, network topologies and hardware, SDN).
preferred_qual:
Expertise in designing, analyzing and troubleshooting large-scale distributed systems.
Systematic problem-solving approach, coupled with strong communication skills and a sense of ownership and drive.
Ability to debug and optimize code and automate routine tasks.
responsibilities:
Engage in and improve the whole lifecycle of services—from inception and design, through deployment, operation and refinement.
Support services before they go live through activities such as system design consulting, developing software platforms and frameworks, capacity planning and launch reviews.
Maintain services once they are live by measuring and monitoring availability, latency and overall system health.
Scale systems sustainably through mechanisms like automation, and evolve systems by pushing for changes that improve reliability and velocity.
Practice sustainable incident response and blameless postmortems.

title: Big Data and Analytics Cloud Consultant
minimum_qual:
Bachelor's degree in a Technical or Engineering field or equivalent practical experience.
7 years of experience designing and deploying distributed data processing systems with one or more technologies (MySQL, Oracle, Cassandra, HBase, Redis, MongoDB, Hadoop, Spark, fluentd, etc.).
7 years of experience reading software code in one or more programming languages (Java, JavaScript, Python, etc.).
Experience in architecting, developing or maintaining production-grade cloud solutions in public clouds such as; Google Cloud platform.
preferred_qual:
Experience in systems design, with the ability to architect or explain complex systems interactions including data flows, common interfaces, APIs and methods available.
Experience architecting, developing and/or maintaining production-grade cloud solutions in virtualized environments.
Ability to work well with a cross-functional, geographically dispersed team and customer base.
Effective cross-functional project management, communication and stakeholder management skills.
Excellent presentation and communication skills, with a focus on translating business requirements into technology solutions.
Ability to travel up to 40% of the time.
responsibilities:
Interact with sales/partner leads and technical stakeholders to translate complex customer requirements into recommendations for appropriate solution architectures and consulting services.
Provide a point of escalation for customer inquiries and serve as the first point of contact to Google for consulting services.
Work with customer technical leads, client executives and partners to manage and deliver successful migrations to cloud solutions.
Work closely with practice areas, Product and Engineering to package best practices and lessons learned into thought leadership, methodologies and published assets.
Understand customer needs and help shape Google’s long term product strategy. Be an advocate of Google’s “product innovation story.”

Work with the team to identify and qualify business opportunities and identify key customer technical objections. Develop the strategy to resolve technical impediments.
Take responsibility for technical aspects of solutions to include such activities as supporting bid responses, product and solution briefings, proof-of-concept work and the coordination of supporting technical resources.
Work closely with Google Cloud Platform products to demonstrate and prototype integrations in customer/partner environments.
Prepare and deliver product messaging in an effort to highlight Google Cloud Platform value proposition using techniques to include whiteboard and slide presentations, product demonstrations, white papers, trial management and response documents.
Deliver recommendations on integration strategies, enterprise architectures, platforms and application infrastructure required to successfully implement a complete solution providing best practice advice to customers to optimize Google Cloud Platform effectiveness.

title: Strategic Cloud Engineer, Google Professional Services
minimum_qual:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
4 years of experience with cloud technologies in any of the following: distributed compute environments, cloud-native application development, hosted services, storage systems, and content delivery networks.
Experience in writing software in one or more languages such as Java, Python, Go, JavaScript, C++, or similar.
Ability to travel up to 30% of the time.
preferred_qual:
Experience automating infrastructure provisioning and/or continuous integration/delivery.
Experience architecting, developing software, or Internet scale production-grade cloud solutions in virtualized environments.
Experience with scalable networking technologies and web standards.
Knowledge of containerization and container orchestration technologies.
Customer facing skills.
responsibilities:
Provide domain expertise on public cloud and enterprise technology.
Work with the customer to design modern technical architectures and solutions that enable their business objectives.
Be a trusted technical advisor and resolve technical challenges for customers.
Create and deliver best practices recommendations, tutorials, blog articles, sample code, and technical presentations adapting to different levels of key business and technical stakeholders.

preferred_qual:

Experience structuring strategic analysis and storylines using spreadsheets and presentations to facilitate communication with senior stakeholders.
Excellent influencing, collaboration and communication skills and ability to work independently as a member of a global team composed of both technical and non-technical members.
responsibilities:

Perform comprehensive audits on agent response through case reviews and develop programs and practices to improve communication, customer interaction, and efficiency.
Define and implement workflow policies and measure adherence and compliance.
Identify workflow improvements and training opportunities that enhance customer experience through better case handling and faster case resolution.
Perform data analysis. Evaluate opportunities to improve performance tracking based on newly identified patterns and signals.

title: Test Engineer, Campus Graduate, 2019 Start
location: New Taipei, Banqiao District, New Taipei City, Taiwan
minimum_qual:

Programming experience developing test automation in Java or Python.
preferred_qual:

Experience with performance or power consumption tests.
Experience building testing automation solutions.
Experience with networking, cellular network, and signal and protocol analyzers.
responsibilities:
Design test plans for new features.
Create automated test cases (primarily in Python/Java).
Calculate and increase test coverage.
Work closely with other Google teams that are testing technologies.
Design and build test solutions (hardware and software).

title: Imaging and Vision Architect
minimum_qual:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or equivalent practical experience
5 years of relevant industry experience.
Experience in C or C++.
Experience developing hardware IP for an imaging or vision pipeline. Experience in digital imaging and computer vision methods and algorithms.
preferred_qual:
Doctorate's degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or a related field.
Experience in array cameras, computational photography techniques, depth sensing cameras and others.
Understanding of image quality metrics.
Understanding of machine learning or image and video processing algorithms for consumer photography or mobile applications.
responsibilities:
Evaluate the architectural design and algorithms for digital photography, computer vision or machine intelligence scenarios.
Design, define, and specify computer vision and image and video processing IP. Author hardware specifications for efficient and practical implementation.
Work with System on a Chip (SoC) architecture team to understand and improve the architecture and use cases.
Work with the image quality and software teams to understand their requirements and to improve the designs.

title: Technical Program Manager, Network Engineering (Vendor Management)
minimum_qual:
Bachelor's degree in a technical/engineering field or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of experience in a related field managing and working with third party vendors; experience in risk/issue analysis.
Experience with managing migration-style projects; projects that involve technology qualification, upgrades and changes during maintenance windows.
Experience supporting or driving technical programs in network deployment/engineering, product design, network content delivery or data center networking within telecommunications or Internet industries.
preferred_qual:
Master's degree in a technical field or equivalent practical experience.
Demonstrated experience defining system and/or process requirements; building, integrating, and/or delivering large-scale layer 2 and layer 3 network systems.
Demonstrated ability to manage multiple priorities in an ambiguous and busy operations environment, and deliver outstanding results in a timely manner.
Knowledge or demonstrated experience with software/cloud applications
Outstanding organizational, multi-tasking, and prioritization abilities; an excellent attention to detail.
responsibilities:
Manage and host regular sync-up meetings covering new technology introduction, strategy, ongoing operations, tech talks, central priority list and ongoing high priority cases. Understand vendor’s product set and determine how the vendor fits strategically within the Google network.
Manage various programs of work, engage teams and engineers; set the pace for development, deployment and delivery of networking systems and infrastructure. Develop and prepare project documentation, process maps, presentations and tracking reports to provide detailed current status of each project.
Work with core teams to develop and articulate tactical plans and long term strategy for Google’s backbone and content distribution requirements. Initiate new programs in response to need and be the catalyst for winning support and driving them through the execution phase.
Analyze numerical network performance and system performance data and translate into recommendations and actionable plans. Provide strong quantitative analysis focus, requiring interpretation of technical and commercial information from structured and unstructured sources.
Use technical judgment to drive project delivery, technology reviews, challenge proposals and build consensus. Present your team's analyses and recommendations to internal stakeholders, including executive management.

title: Data Center Technician (English, Italian)
location: Milan, Metropolitan City of Milan, Italy
minimum_qual:
Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
Ability to lift/move (25kg~) equipment as required.
Ability to speak and write in English and Italian fluently and idiomatically.
Ability to work non-standard work hours, including weekends, holidays and on shift-based schedules as required. Ability to travel throughout Europe 50% of the time as required.
preferred_qual:
Experience working with and troubleshooting hardware/network related issues using Linux based tools.
Experience working extensively on data center server and networking hardware, with a solid understanding of the infrastructure at a high level.
Experience as a team, project or technical lead.
Experience with hardware architecture, maintenance and repair.
Advanced level Linux skills, including installation, systems administration and troubleshooting, and knowledge of networking including topology and protocols.
Effective people and communication skills.
responsibilities:
Contribute to and lead efforts/projects in the deployment, maintenance, and support of current and new data center infrastructure.
Lead complex troubleshooting and resolve critical or escalated technical issues regarding affected equipment.
Test and troubleshoot complex server hardware components and designs.
Configure and troubleshoot Linux OS related issues on our servers.
Lead and take part in the development of processes and documentation for new areas of work or knowledge. Mentor, train and guide new team members.

title: Radio Frequency Hardware Engineer, Consumer Hardware
minimum_qual:
Master’s degree in Electrical Engineering, Radio Frequencies, or Electromagnetics, or equivalent practical experience.
3 years of experience designing Radio Frequency solutions for Consumer Electronics.
preferred_qual:
Experience in RF design in consumer products, including using common RF test equipment (spectrum analyzers, network analyzers, oscilloscopes, protocol and signaling testers) and antenna chambers in a hands-on lab environment.
Familiarity with simulation tools and circuit simulation capability, such as ADS, scripting, and automation tools for data collection and analysis.
Familiarity with regulatory requirements (FCC, IC, CE, etc.), carrier specifications, 3GPP, 3GPP2, and their respective certification process.
Knowledge of different wireless communication systems such as GSM/UMTS/CDMA/LTE, 802.11, Bluetooth, GPS, etc.
Board-level and firmware debug skills, and familiarity with schematic creation and printed circuit board (PCB) design.
responsibilities:
Define architecture, specification, design and test boards for innovative consumer electronics devices.
Design and optimize RF system solutions, including cellular technologies LTE, UMTS, CDMA, GSM, WLAN, BT, and GPS.
Design for volume manufacturing and support factory engineers from prototyping to product launch.
Manage PCB design for optimal RF performance.
Work with component vendors and partners to develop the RF frontend.

title: Coding Assessment Developer (Area 120)
minimum_qual:
Bachelor's degree in Math, Computer Science, Coding Bootcamp graduate, or equivalent practical experience.
Experience with one or more general purpose programming languages including but not limited to: Java, JavaScript or Python.
preferred_qual:
5 years of experience in software engineering, and coding experience in one or more of the following languages: Java, C/C++, C#, Objective-C, Python, JavaScript, PHP, Ruby or Go.
Experience as an educator, especially with designing curriculum, writing test questions, and evaluating skill competencies.
responsibilities:
Design assessment questions, write design specs, and write code in one or more languages to underpin technical assessments.
Work with engineers to adapt questions to additional programming languages or frameworks
Manage and conduct user studies to ensure a consistent and positive experience
Streamline and improve grading criteria.
Ad hoc work as needed by the team.

title: Mobile SOC Power Management Architect, Consumer Hardware
minimum_qual:
BS degree in Electrical Engineering or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of experience in power management or low power design/methodology.
Experience with ASIC power analysis methodology.
preferred_qual:
MS/PhD degree in Electronics, Computer Engineering or Computer Science, with an emphasis on computer architecture and performance and power analysis.
Experience with power components, power modeling, power trees, power distribution network and design.
Experience with low power design techniques (such as multi Vth/power/voltage domain design, clock gating, power gating, Dynamic Voltage Frequency Scaling (DVFS)/AVS, etc).
Experience in droop detection and mitigation, adaptive clock distribution, aging and process monitors.
Knowledge of industry trends and disruptive technologies. Knowledge of the impact of software and architectural design decisions on power and thermal behavior of the system, such as thermal mitigation and scheduling, and cross-layer policy design.
Familiarity with PMIC, SMPS and LDO.
responsibilities:
Define System on Chip (SoC) power management (architectural and micro-architectural) details for an SoC that includes functions such as image compute, CPU/GPU, for maximum performance under power and thermal constraints.
Perform algorithm development, modeling and analysis of power management approaches.
Identify power optimization techniques applicable at different design levels.
Produce detailed documents for the proposed implementation or power management block. Produce detailed trade-off analysis for engineering reviews and product roadmap decisions.

title: Corporate Operations Engineer

Excellent customer service, organizational, prioritization, multitasking, communication and leadership skills.
responsibilities:
Improve user experience by leading, designing and implementing technical initiatives collaboratively while focusing on user satisfaction and pain points through direct interaction.
Develop solutions for technical challenges, through root cause analysis, working with users and collaborating with partner teams.
Troubleshoot multiple operating systems and a range of devices (e.g. desktops, laptops, phone systems, video conferencing and various wireless devices).
Collaborate with various global teams including Security, Networking and Infrastructure.
Support IT needs from global offices of all sizes and Googlers of varying technical backgrounds.

title: Developer Advocate, Google Payments
minimum_qual:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a similar technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
3 years of experience in software engineering.
Experience in presenting/speaking at technology conferences/hackathons/webinars.
Web development experience
preferred_qual:

Android App/Web development experience
Familiarity with web technologies.
Proven communications and teamwork skills with strong initiative.

Create momentum and drive the success of Google Pay APIs through your interactions with third-party developers with a specific focus on North and South America.
Advocate for the adoption of Google Pay to strategic partners and the broader developer community. Provide input on building a global outreach strategy for Google Pay.
Participate in technical and design discussions with technical executives at strategic partners to ensure adoption and best practices during implementation. Establish deeper developer insights and needs through gathering market intelligence and research.
Advocate Google Pay APIs in person and online by presenting at conferences, blogging, videos, writing technical docs, tutorials, code samples and other similar activities.
Advocate for developers internally, and consult Google developer product strategy by working with Product Management, Engineering, PR, Marketing, Business Development and other cross-functional teams.

title: High Performance Computing Cloud Consultant , Google Cloud
minimum_qual:
MBA or M.S. in Computer Science or related Software Engineering field, or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of hands-on experience building, maintaining and/or operating grid computing clusters and data management systems.
Experience in writing software in one or more languages (Java, Go, JavaScript, Python, etc.).
Ability to travel up to 30% of the time.
preferred_qual:
Experience with commercial or academic distributed Grid systems and related Cloud integrations.
Experience with one or more schedulers (e.g. PBS and derivatives, HTCondor, Data Synapse, Slurm, LSF, Grid Engine, derivatives, etc.) and Orchestration systems (e.g. Elasticluster, DAGMan, Pegasus, GlideinWMS, etc).
Experience with Filers and Data Access systems (e.g. NFS servers, Elastifile, Avere, glusterfs, Isilon, Bluearc, Lustre, Ceph, HDFS, dCache, etc.) and cluster-oriented network topologies and solutions based on Ethernet or Infiniband.
Experience with deployment and orchestration technologies (e.g. Puppet, Chef, Salt, Ansible, Docker, Kubernetes, Mesos, OpenStack, Jenkins, etc.) and in system administration tasks in Linux, Unix, or Windows with familiarity with standard IT security practices (e.g. encryption, certificates, key management, etc).
Developed project management, presentation and communication skills, with the ability to translate business requirements into technology solutions.
responsibilities:
Interact with sales/partner leads and technical stakeholders to translate complex customer requirements into recommendations for solution architectures and consulting services.
Work with a team of technical consultants, provide a point of escalation for customer inquiries, coach and grow team members' skills in consulting delivery.
Work with customer technical leads, client executives, and partners to implement High Performance and High Throughput Computing solutions such as orchestration, scheduling, data access, interprocess communication, benchmarking, performance management.
Understand customer needs and help shape Google’s long term product strategy.

title: Data Center Technician (English, Dutch)
minimum_qual:
Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
Ability to work non-standard work hours as needed including working weekends, holidays and shift-based schedules.
Ability to speak and write in English and Dutch fluently in a working environment.
preferred_qual:
Experience working extensively on data center server and networking hardware, with a solid understanding of the infrastructure at a high level.
Experience with, and demonstrated understanding of, hardware architecture, maintenance and repair. Experience as a team, project or technical lead.
Advanced Linux skills, including installation, systems administration and troubleshooting. Advanced Networking knowledge, including topology and protocol understanding.
Effective people and communication skills.
Ability to speak and write in English and Dutch fluently in a working environment.
Ability to lift/move (25kg~) equipment as required.
responsibilities:
Contribute to and lead efforts/projects in the deployment, maintenance, and support of current and new data center infrastructure.
Lead complex troubleshooting and resolve critical or escalated technical issues over a significant population of affected equipment.
Help test and troubleshoot new complex server hardware components and designs.
Configure and troubleshoot Linux OS-related issues on our servers. Participate actively in on-call rotations to support our data center infrastructure, which may include occasional after hours, weekend and/or national holiday shift work.
Lead and take part in the development of processes and documentation for new areas of work or knowledge. Mentor, train and guide new team members.

title: Sales Engineer, Google Cloud Platform
minimum_qual:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, related field or equivalent practical experience.
Experience as a Technical Sales Engineer in a cloud computing environment or equivalent experience in a customer-facing role and as a member of a professional services or systems engineering team.
preferred_qual:
Master's degree in Computer Science or other technical field.
Experience with Big Data, PaaS, and IaaS technologies.
Experience of architecting and developing software or infrastructure for scalable, distributed systems.
Understanding of data and information management.
Ability to quickly learn, understand and work with new emerging technologies, methodologies, and solutions in the Cloud/IT space.
Excellent presentation skills.
responsibilities:
Work with teams to identify and qualify business opportunities, identify key customer technical objections and develop the strategy to resolve technical impediments to transactions. Travel to customer sites, conferences etc. as required.
Take responsibility for technical aspects of solutions to include such activities as supporting bid responses, product and solution briefings, proof-of-concept work and the coordination of supporting technical resources.
Work hands-on with Google Cloud Platform products to demonstrate and prototype integrations in customer/partner environments.
Present, demonstrate and run workshops using G Suite, Chrome and mobility devices to highlight their business value and organizational impact.
Prepare and deliver product messaging in an effort to highlight Google Cloud Platform and G Suite value proposition using techniques to include whiteboard and slide presentations, product demonstrations, white papers, trial management and RFI/RFP response documents.

title: Sales Engineer, Google Cloud Platform
minimum_qual:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or equivalent practical experience.
Experience as a Technical Sales Engineer in a cloud computing environment or equivalent experience in a customer-facing role and as a member of a professional services or systems engineering team.
preferred_qual:
Master's degree in Computer Science or other technical field.
Experience with Big Data, PaaS, and IaaS technologies.
Experience in, and understanding of, data and information management - especially as it relates to big data trends and issues within businesses.
Experience architecting and developing software or infrastructure for scalable, distributed systems.
Ability to quickly learn, understand, and work with new emerging technologies, methodologies, and solutions in the cloud/IT technology space.
Effective presentation skills.
responsibilities:
Work with the team to identify and qualify business opportunities, identify key customer technical objections and develop the strategy to resolve technical impediments to transactions. Travel to customer sites, conferences, and other related engagements as required.
Take responsibility for technical aspects of solutions, to include such activities as supporting bid responses, product and solution briefings, proof-of-concept work and the coordination of supporting technical resources.
Work hands-on with Google Cloud Platform products to demonstrate and prototype integrations in customer/partner environments.
Present, demonstrate and run workshops using G Suite, Chrome and mobility devices to highlight their business value and organizational impact.
Prepare and deliver product messaging in an effort to highlight the Google Cloud Platform and G Suite value proposition, using techniques to include whiteboard and slide presentations, product demonstrations, white papers, trial management and RFI/RFP response documents.

title: Technical Solutions Consultant, Android Wearables
minimum_qual:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering or related field, or equivalent practical experience.
4 years of experience in technical account management, product management, software engineering or engineering program management.
Experience working with computer languages (e.g., Java, C++ or Python) and Linux environments.
preferred_qual:
Experience in mobile device and application development and an understanding of mobile ecosystem trends.
Experience with wearable technologies (e.g., smartwatches, hybrid watches, fitness tracker, ear wear, etc.)
Ability to code in Python and Shell.
Track record of building successful relationships and influence with technical and executive audiences.
Demonstrated creative problem-solving approach, excellent analytical skills, a sense of ownership and a proactive can-do attitude.
Excellent communication and project management skills with a track record of handling multiple customers and streams of work.
responsibilities:
Perform implementation reviews, advocate new product features and ensure the prompt and proper resolution of technical challenges.
Improve product feature offerings by providing partner feedback to internal cross-functional teams including Product Management, Business Development and Engineering.
Guarantee the technical aspects of a partner’s integration (both new and ongoing) by providing necessary documentation and technical guidance.
Support efforts to increase new business opportunities via Google technologies.

title: Technical Program Manager, Network Capacity Engineering
minimum_qual:
BS degree in a technical field or equivalent practical experience.
4 years of experience managing multi-group, multi-disciplinary projects from evaluation and design to execution.
Experience driving technical programs in network capacity planning, deployment/engineering, product design, network content delivery or data center networking within telecommunications or Internet industries.
Experience with managing migration-style projects; projects that involve upgrades and changes during maintenance windows.
preferred_qual:
Master's degree in a technical field or equivalent practical experience.
Experience with software development, data analysis pipelines and statistics.
Demonstrated experience defining system and/or process requirements, building, integrating, and/or delivering large-scale layer 2 and layer 3 network systems.
Knowledge or demonstrated experience with capacity planning and/or supply chain planning.
Demonstrated ability to manage multiple priorities in an ambiguous and busy operations environment; deliver outstanding results in a timely manner. Excellent organizational, multi-tasking and prioritization abilities; excellent attention to detail.
responsibilities:
Work with core teams to develop and articulate tactical plans and long term strategy for Google’s backbone, campus and content distribution requirements. Initiate new programs in response to need and be the catalyst for winning support and driving them through the execution phase.
Manage various programs of work, engage teams and engineers, set the pace for development, deployment and delivery of networking systems and infrastructure. Develop and prepare project documentation, process maps, presentations and tracking reports to provide detailed current status of each project.
Use technical judgment to drive project delivery, technology reviews, challenge proposals and build consensus.
Analyze numerical network performance and system performance data and translate into recommendations and actionable plans. Provide strong quantitative analysis focus, requiring interpretation of technical and commercial information from structured and unstructured sources.
Present your team's analyses and recommendations to internal stakeholders, including executive management.

title: Engineering Practicum Intern, Summer 2019
minimum_qual:
Must be a first-year or second-year undergraduate student currently pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related technical field at a university in North America.
Programming experience in one or more of the following languages: C, C++, Java, JavaScript or Python.
First-year students must have taken one college level Computer Science course by end of first semester. (AP or IB Computer Science is acceptable).
Students must be available for a full-time 12-week internship from May 2019 to August 2019 or June 2019 to September 2019.
preferred_qual:
Second-year students should have taken two Computer Science courses.
Authorization to work in the United States.
Returning to a Bachelor's degree program with at least two years remaining in their academic program after completion of the Summer 2019 internship.
responsibilities:
Project: Complete a challenging technical project where you’ll get to build solutions and get exposure to immense scale and complexity.
Enrichment: Attend technical talks by senior Googlers, gain insight into technical interview preparation, learn about Google coding practices and technologies, and develop other skills that will set you up for success.
Mentorship: Receive coaching and mentorship from Google engineers to guide you through your summer experience.
Connect: Build personal networks and friendships with a diverse group of students who share your passion for technology.

preferred_qual:
Second-year students should have taken two Computer Science courses.
Authorization to work in the United States.
Returning to a Bachelor's degree program with at least two years remaining in their academic program after completion of the Summer 2019 internship.
responsibilities:
Project: Complete a challenging technical project where you’ll get to build solutions and get exposure to immense scale and complexity.
