title: Hardware Development Engineer/Electrical Engineer, Home, Consumer Hardware
location: Xindian District, New Taipei City, Taiwan
minimum_qual:
BS degree in Electrical Engineering or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of experience working with consumer electronics, and experience in the consumer hardware development process.
Electrical Engineering or Design experience in one or more of these areas: SOCs/MCUs, Power Management, Signal Integrity and/or Analog/RF.
Ability to travel as required.
preferred_qual:
Experience with the JDM/ODM model of consumer manufacturing.
Experience leading small teams or mentoring junior Engineers.
Experience writing diagnostic test and automation software in Python, Labview or similar environment for bringup and testing.
Understanding of hardware product execution such as industrial design, cost and factory operations.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
responsibilities:
Design Google Home products, understand product requirements and translating them into technical requirements. Assess early feasibility of implementation and follow through with detailed design.
Design low-level schematics with industry standard tools like ORCAD, Concept, Allegro, etc.
Direct and review Printed Circuit Board (PCB) layout and electrical simulation teams.
Troubleshoot, debug and resolve issues during development including factory prototype builds.

title: Hardware Operations Regional Manager, Data Centers
minimum_qual:
Bachelor's degree in a technical field or equivalent practical experience.
20 years of experience with Linux/Unix system administration and networking, working in data centers and building out infrastructure.
10 years of experience managing technical teams, team leads or managers.
preferred_qual:
5 years of experience managing managers across distributed sites.
Knowledge of HVAC and power requirements for high-availability data centers.
Knowledge of PC hardware architecture, maintenance, and repair.
Demonstrated strategic problem-solving skills.
responsibilities:
Manage the deployment and operations of hardware for Google’s computing cloud at data centers.
Collaborate within cross-functional teams to deploy platforms.
Lead and direct various process and structure innovations to help create and maintain excellent global operations.
Coordinate with other regional directors to maintain a globally-consistent operations organization.
Collaborate with management at multiple sites.

title: Contact Channels Manager (Google Cloud Support)
minimum_qual:
3 years of experience as product, program or project manager. Experience contributing to multiple initiatives.
Experience with support CRM technology (e.g. Salesforce service cloud).
Experience configuring and/or documenting systems configuration requirements for internal technical systems.
Experience working in technical support or call center operations environment.
preferred_qual:
Experience in identifying business opportunities and defining and measuring success of proposed initiatives. Strong creativity in discovering actionable results and strategies.
Experience working in a multi-channel client/customer support environment (e.g., email, phone, chat, social).
Familiarity with customer support measurement, KPIs, reporting and insight analysis.
Passion for technology and an ability to identify new opportunities, drive collaboration and deliver high-quality, complex projects across teams.
Ability to consistently deliver quality outputs in a high paced and dynamic environment with an ability to work to tight deadlines.
responsibilities:
Manage projects with varying levels of complexity and scope, with responsibility for developing well defined milestones and success criteria, resource allocation and successful on-time delivery.
Work closely with members of the global Google Cloud business and extended teams including but not limited to engineering, product and support to identify and build solutions and processes that are optimized using industry best-practices and successful in meeting the global/local objectives of the Google Cloud support teams.
Manage and build upon existing infrastructure as well as gather and document critical business requirements to manage requests related to contact channels.
Initiate, recommend, and formulate systems, tools and project improvements that enable Google Cloud Support objectives.
Serve as subject matter expert in multi-channel support initiatives in collaboration with stakeholders by gathering requirements, defining scope, creating business cases, developing project plans and schedules, driving and managing implementation/deployment.

title: Technical Program Manager, Software Infrastructure Deployment for New Product Introduction
minimum_qual:
BA/BS degree in Computer Science or a related field, or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of experience with software development lifecycle, metric definition and executive presentation, technical program management, system and/or process requirements for large-scale systems.
5 years of experience in a technical organization within infrastructure, supply chain, computer hardware, or data centers.
preferred_qual:
5 years of Product Management experience.
Experience in leading teams of highly talented, independent individuals.
Ability to identify organizational needs, establish priorities, work independently and drive results through informal authority.
Ability to serve as a trusted consultant to key business partners and represent users and customers in every thought and interaction.
responsibilities:
Run large programs and ensure that they are moving forward.
Scope, plan, and manage projects, including management of associated financial and human resources, quality of software development and features, risks, schedules, communication plans, and deliverables.
Provide management with forecasts of project deliverables and detailed status updates.
Present your team's analyses, recommendations, and approaches to stakeholders and executive management.
Initiate new software development programs, identify and deliver software features that drive performance, scale, functionality, security, quality, and efficiency, based on prioritized needs. Be the catalyst for program support and delivery.

title: Speech Technology Solutions Consultant, Cloud AI
minimum_qual:
Bachelor's degree in a technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
Experience writing software in one or more languages (e.g., Java, Python, Go, JavaScript, C++, etc.).
Experience interacting with enterprise customers and partners and driving cross-functional technical projects.
Experience working in a cloud environment
preferred_qual:
Experience working with AI products or technology solutions specific to industrial verticals (e.g., Retail, Manufacturing, Finance)
Experience with speech recognition or speech synthesis technology.
Experience with web technologies for development, setup, configuration, and Deployment.
responsibilities:
Provide end-to-end support (e.g., pre-sale consultation, evaluation, post-sale implementation, deployment) for customers throughout product lifecycle.
Gain an understanding of customer challenges and customize/optimize Google Cloud Speech products as needed to fit customer needs by developing tools and scripts.
Enable scaled support via documentation, training, and education, of both internal, and external scaled support teams.
Serve as the first escalation point within the Cloud AI team to frontline and scale support teams.
Consolidate, synthesize, and prioritize product feedback (e.g., bugs, FR) from customers, partners, and other teams to ensure fast product iteration and improvements.

title: Signal and Power Integrity Design Engineer, Consumer Hardware
minimum_qual:
Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering or equivalent practical experience.
Experience with industry SI simulation and lab tools (e.g., Ansys HFSS, SIwave, Designer, Cadence Sigrity tools, ADS, Hspice, TDR, VNA, probe station and real-time scope).
Experience in signal and power integrity simulation of system boards, including SoC/chipset, DDR memory and other high-speed communication interfaces.
preferred_qual:
Master's degree or PhD in Electrical Engineering or Computer Engineering.
5 years of experience in power integrity and signal integrity.
Experience with the consumer product development process for mass volume production design, with a focus on power and signal integrity, EMC, EMI or ESD.
Experience with EDA tools, such as Q3D, PowerDC, Allegro, APD and Keysight.
Experience with PDN model extraction, simulation and lab validation, SOC package bumpout, ballout assignment, and trade off.
Experience in the emerging market field. Experience with transmission line theory.
responsibilities:
Own the SOC package electrical design and validation. Provide design guidelines on how to use the chip in a system environment.
Provide input to the package design feasibility study from a power integrity (PI) and signal integrity (SI) perspective.
Provide a model extraction for the package and PCB. Perform frequency domain and time domain PI simulation.
Package the electrical characterization, chip functional validation, stress test and correlation study.
Provide system-level design guidelines for SOC power and peripheral IO.

title: Security Engineer, Detection
minimum_qual:
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in coding and scripting using one or more of the following programs: Java, Python, Go, C, C++, and/or similar.
Experience in a relevant role or environment.
preferred_qual:
Experience in analyzing the security of systems (penetration testing, Web Application security testing, vulnerability scanning, threat modeling, etc).
Experience responding to security issues in target-rich environments, looking at security alerts, front-line analysis and response.
Demonstrated expertise working with malware analysis, including investigations of botnet and rootkit behavior.
Demonstrated expertise with signals development and, threat hunting/modeling.
Expertise in spearheading analysis of large data sets and intrusion detection systems.
responsibilities:
Participate in a 24/7 global operation that hunts for and responds to security events on Google networks.
Perform investigations on a wide variety of events from various sources to determine whether they pose a threat.
Participate in resolving large-scale security incidents.
Work with teams from around Google to discover new detection capabilities and logging sources.

title: Program Manager, Technical Enablement, Google Cloud
minimum_qual:
5 years of experience in training and enablement or sales/technical leadership.
Ability to travel up to 20% of the time as required.
preferred_qual:
Experience designing and implementing sales methodology and/or technical training programs. Experience creating and managing credential and certification programs.
Experience coordinating and managing large-scale training events.
Experience with cloud technologies.
Demonstrated ability to lead and manage without direct authority.
Ability to maintain curriculum in a Learning Management System.
Effective program and project management skills. Ability to take broad concepts and vision to develop structured plans, actions and measurable metrics and effectively execute those plans.

Oversee the development of training content by partnering with  Curriculum Development teams, Product Managers and other subject matter experts.

Plan and execute key enablement events and conferences with the appropriate pre/post-event activities to drive learning.
Design and implement metrics to measure training programs’ impact, effectiveness, appropriateness and utility. Measure and report on the effectiveness of enablement investments.

minimum_qual:

Experience with web services related standards such as HTTP, REST, SOAP, and OAuth.

title: Product Manager
minimum_qual:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or equivalent practical experience.
Product management or design experience with a focus on internet products and technologies.

preferred_qual:
End-to-end product management experience with software/web technologies.
Knowledge of the internet, search engines and online advertising spaces.
Knowledge of multiple functional areas such as Product Management, Engineering, UX/UI, Sales, Customer Support, Finance or Marketing.
Understanding of user experience (UX) and business/commercial challenges.
Understanding of Go-to-Market commerce enablers (e.g. payments, loyalty, subscriptions, etc.).
responsibilities:
Define, lead, and execute holistic strategy to work towards strategic business goals, collaborating as needed across regions, product areas, and functions.
Launch new products and features, test their performance, and iterate constantly and quickly. Identify opportunities and define product vision and strategy.

Synthesize and drive product strategy from interactions with customers, business stakeholders, Legal, and Policy teams and build and manage an actionable product roadmap.
Launch solutions that demonstrate product excellence and solve customer challenges.

title: Partner Engineer, Google Cloud
minimum_qual:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related technical field or equivalent practical experience.
Experience serving in the capacity of a technical sales engineer in a cloud computing environment, or equivalent experience in a customer and/or partner-facing role (including working as a member of a professional services, solutions architect or systems engineering team).
Ability speak and write in Dutch and English fluently and idiomatically.
Ability to travel up to 40% of the time as required.
preferred_qual:
Experience in, and understanding of, data and information management, especially as it relates to big data trends and issues within businesses. Experience using and/or managing databases.

Experience architecting and developing solutions for scalable, distributed systems.
Knowledge of enterprise networking and identity management systems. Knowledge of Big Data, PaaS, SaaS, IaaS, public cloud, and related industry and technical concepts, as well as working knowledge of web application development platforms and related technologies.
Ability to craft a compelling message and tailor it for a given audience. Ability to mix deep technical expertise with simple, everyday language to deliver a story that is memorable and useful.
Ability to quickly learn, understand, and work with new emerging technologies, methodologies, and solutions in the Cloud technology space.
responsibilities:

Develop our partners’ technical teams with both sales and technical competencies, so that they can be successful in the market.
Keep partners up-to-date with product and technical knowledge and market differentiators.
Work with partner technical representatives in opportunities and projects, complementing their skill and guaranteeing high quality customer deliverables. Act as a technical advocate within Google for our partners in order to help provide feedback from the field, as well as to present on their behalf.

title: ASIC/SoC Design Verification Engineer, Consumer Hardware

responsibilities:
Plan the verification of complex digital design blocks by fully understanding the design specification and interacting with design engineers to identify important verification scenarios.

Debug tests with design engineers to deliver functionally correct design blocks.
Close coverage measures to identify verification holes and to show progress towards tape-out.

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
Experience working with PaaS and SaaS technologies, including content management, identity and access management (IAM), security, scripting and search user experience (UI/UX) practices.
Experience working as a technical customer engineer in a cloud computing environment or equivalent experience in a customer-facing role, working as a member of a Professional Services or Systems Engineering team.
preferred_qual:
Experience with enterprise search third-party content and identity connectors, indexing approaches and traversal strategies.
Knowledge and understanding of Identity, Security and SAML/Oauth 2.0 as it applies to enterprise search.
Understanding of search best practices with regard to search quality (relevance ranking, query understanding, NLP etc.), metadata ingestion.
Ability to quickly learn, understand and work with emerging technologies and solutions in the cloud/IT technology space.
Effective presentation skills, with the ability to deliver a technical presentation to customers.
responsibilities:
Work with customers to identify and qualify business opportunities, identify key technical objections and develop strategies to resolve technical blockers.
Work with teams to formulate solutions for customers and prospects that align with Google Cloud Search messaging.
Work closely with Product and Engineering teams to formulate customer-specific solutions, share feedback from customers and assist in refining the product roadmap.
Share in-depth Google Cloud Search expertise to support the technical relationship with Google’s customers, including product and solution briefings, proof-of-concept work and the coordination and prioritization of solutions impacting customer adoption of Google Cloud Search.
Work with customers to demonstrate and prototype Google Cloud Search product integrations in customer/partner environments. Travel to customer sites/conferences as required.

title: Technical Solutions Consultant, Android Partner Engineering
minimum_qual:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
4 years of experience working in either; technical account management, product management, software engineering or engineering program management.
preferred_qual:
Experience in mobile device/application development and understanding of mobile ecosystem trends.
Experience in working with enterprise software or hardware vendors.
Demonstrated skills in scripting languages such as; Python and Shell.
Demonstrated creative problem-solving approach and effective analytical skills, combined with a sense of ownership and a proactive can-do attitude.
Excellent communication and project management skills, with a demonstrated record of handling multiple customers and streams of work.
responsibilities:
Perform implementation reviews, advocate for new product features, and ensure the prompt and proper resolution of technical challenges.
Improve product feature offerings by providing partner feedback to internal cross-functional teams, including Product Management and Engineering.
Guarantee the technical aspects of a partner’s integration (both new and ongoing) by providing necessary documentation and technical guidance.
Identify, drive and optimize the business growth flow from new business opportunities by leveraging Google technologies.

title: SAP Solutions Consultant, Google Cloud (English)
minimum_qual:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, related Software Engineering field or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in cloud computing (e.g., infrastructure, storage, platforms, data), cloud market dynamics and customer buying behavior.
Experience in data and information lifecycle management, relating to SAP portfolio and technologies.
Ability to speak and write in English fluently and idiomatically.
preferred_qual:
Master's degree in Computer Science or other relevant technical field. Experience with Big Data, PaaS, and IaaS technologies.
Experience with and deep knowledge of SAP technologies (SAP Business Suite, SAP S/4HANA, SAP Business Warehouse, SAP Hybris, SAP Business Objects, Sybase, Leonardo suite, etc.), architecture and infrastructure needs.
Experience with SAP HANA, including sizing, disaster recovery, multi-tenancy concepts, scale-out architectures and data tiering.
Extensive experience as Chief Security Officer or Technical Sales Engineer in a cloud-computing environment or equivalent experience in a customer-facing role working as a member of a professional services or systems engineering team.
Understanding of SAP cloud offerings and SAP cloud platform.
Ability to quickly learn, understand and work with new emerging technologies, methodologies, and solutions in the cloud technology space.
responsibilities:
Identify business and technical requirements, conduct full technical discovery and architect client solutions to meet gathered requirements.
Take responsibility for leading the technical project, including technology advocacy, supporting bid responses, product and solution briefings, proof-of-concept work and the coordination of supporting technical resources.
Prepare and deliver product messaging in an effort to highlight the Google Cloud platform value proposition by using whiteboard and slide presentations, product demonstrations, white papers, trial management and Request for Information (RFI) response documents.
Make recommendations on integration strategies, enterprise architectures, platforms and application infrastructure required to successfully implement a complete solution providing best practice advice to customers to optimize Google Cloud platform effectiveness.
Communicate effectively with English-speaking clients.

title: Customer Engineer, Google Cloud Platform (Portuguese, English)
location: São Paulo, State of São Paulo, Brazil
minimum_qual:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of experience serving in the capacity of a Technical Sales Engineer in a cloud computing environment, or equivalent experience in a customer-facing role (including working as a member of a professional services or systems engineering team).
Ability to speak and write in Portuguese and English fluently and idiomatically.
preferred_qual:
Master's degree in Computer Science or a related technical field.
Experience with Big Data, PaaS and IaaS technologies. Experience in, and understanding of, data and information management - especially as it relates to Big Data trends and issues within businesses. Hands-on experience using and/or managing databases.
Experience in architecting and developing software for scalable, distributed systems. Demonstrated proficiency with Map Reduce, Hadoop, Spark, Flume, Hive, Impala, SparkSQL, BigQuery.
Working knowledge of Linux, Web 2.0 development platforms, solutions, and related technologies (e.g. HTTP, Basic/NTLM,sessions, XML/XSLT/XHTML/HTML). Understanding of DNS, TCP, Firewalls, Proxy Servers, DMZ, Load Balancing, VPN, VPC.
Experience in web application development and integration. Experience with software development platforms and solutions (e.g. J2EE, Java servlets, JavaScript, Python, GO, PHP, ASP, CGI, AJAX, etc).
Ability to quickly learn, understand, and work with new and emerging technologies, methodologies, and solutions in the Cloud/IT Technology space.
responsibilities:
Use your technical expertise to help a client determine if Google Cloud Platform is right for them.
Work with the Sales team to identify and qualify Platform opportunities through a formal business process. Conduct full technical discovery, identifying pain points, along with business and technical requirements, “as is” and “to be” scenarios, and architecting client solutions to meet gathered requirements.
Take full responsibility for the technical aspects of the business cycle, including introductory meetings, supporting bid responses, product and solution briefings, proof-of-concept work, and the coordination of additional supporting technical resources. Identify and handle key customer technical objections, prescriptively guiding them to success.
Prepare and deliver product messaging in an effort to highlight Google Cloud Platform value proposition and unique differentiators, using whiteboarding, slide presentations, product demonstrations, white papers, trial management and RFI response documents.
Work hands-on with Google's Cloud Platform products to demonstrate and prototype integrations in customer/partner environments. Make recommendations on integration strategies, enterprise architectures, platforms and application infrastructure required to successfully implement a complete solution, providing “best practice” advice to customers to optimize Google Cloud Platform effectiveness.

title: Technical Solutions Consultant, Partner Engineering, Google AI
minimum_qual:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics or a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
10 years of relevant work experience in managing internal or client-facing projects to completion. Experience in troubleshooting clients' technical issues, and in working with engineering, sales and service teams and customers.
Experience in writing software in one or more languages such as Java, Python, Go, JavaScript, C++, or similar. Experience with any of the following: distributed compute environments, application development, mobile development, big data analytics, and cloud computing (including virtualization, hosted services, multi tenant cloud infrastructures, storage systems and content delivery networks).
Ability to travel 50% of the time as required.
preferred_qual:
Experience in working with senior-level engineers/researchers, product and/or program managers, clinician advisors, regulatory/quality, legal, UX, BD, privacy, policy, security, and marketing to deliver new products in healthcare
Experience in building partner relationships and engaging cross-functional groups. Strong strategic and entrepreneurial thinker.
Experience within the healthcare and life sciences environments within public/private cloud settings.
Hands-on focus in cloud storage technologies and schemes, technical solutions consulting, and partner engineering.
Demonstrable expertise in driving fast paced medical software/device development and integrations in regulated areas; machine learning/biostatistics/analytics background.
Excel with minimal guidance, comfortable with learning new domains and driving product direction in ambiguous environments.
responsibilities:
Engage and work hands-on with partner technical representatives to bridge their existing environments and solutions with Google Brain through Google Cloud. Develop proof-of-concepts allowing partners, together with Google Engineering, to build solutions that accelerate deployments.
Deliver “best-practice” advice to partners on optimizing data input pipelines and inference integration strategies by documenting partners’ enterprise architectures, platforms and application infrastructure required to successfully implement a complete solution
Program manage the gathering, organizing and sharing of feedback to/from product/eng teams (e.g. coordinate on-site UX research, simulations, trials etc.) as well as partnerships/strategy teams (e.g. surface insights on how operational insights can influence legal/Go-to-Market tactics)
Demonstrate thought leadership in partner engineering at this unique intersection between large quantities and complex structure of medical datasets to become a trusted advisor to partner stakeholders
Travel to testbed site(s) starting at 50% onsite at testbed sites during the first 6 months of engagement and tapering down to 25% travel as deployment matures

title: Strategic Cloud Engineer, G Suite, Google Cloud Professional Services
minimum_qual:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
Experience serving in the capacity of a technical consultant or advisor, or equivalent client-facing engineering experience.
Experience writing scripts in one or more languages such as Python, Go, or similar.
preferred_qual:
Experience with hosted services and/or multi-tenant cloud infrastructures.
Experience in system administration, troubleshooting, routing, and best practices with industry leading products.
Understanding of common directory administration systems (e.g., Active Directory, OpenLDAP).
Understanding of networking and security fundamentals and common networking architectures.
responsibilities:
Be a technical advisor to customers and solve complex cloud infrastructure and networking challenges.
Create and deliver best practices recommendations, tutorials, blog articles, sample code, and technical presentations adapting to different levels of key business and technical stakeholders.
Travel up to 30% of the time for in-region for meetings, technical reviews, and onsite delivery activities.

title: Technical Program Manager, Machine Maintenance, Hardware Operations
minimum_qual:
Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Computer Science or other Quantitative field (e.g. Physics, Mathematics, Chemistry, Statistics), or equivalent practical experience.
7 years of experience in software and/or hardware development/integration and technical program management.
Experience supporting or driving programs in a technical organization.
Experience defining system and/or process requirements for large-scale systems.
preferred_qual:
Masters degree in Computer Science, Engineering or Mathematics.
Experience in leading teams of highly talented, independent individuals with a track record of quickly earning credibility based on your knowledge and accomplishments.
Experience in delivering solutions and completing complex hardware/software or infrastructure projects in data center environments.
Experience in software programming and scripting.
Demonstrated experience with machine learning.
Ability to develop and validate complex models for quantifying machine fleet health.
responsibilities:
Lead several technical programs for hardware fleet management, including several machine learning platforms, setting priorities for various cross-functional partners, leading cross-functional teams to execute on projects critical to Google data center fleet scalability.
Work closely with various Product Areas (PAs), Site Reliability Engineers (SREs), Product Area Research Managers (PARMs) and distill their machine fleet needs and execute them cross-functionally in an efficient and scalable fashion.
Guide other fleet maintenance Technical Program Managers spread geographically in successfully executing fleet scalability and repair process standardization.
Provide hands-on project management, cross-functional coordination, manage release schedules, milestones, stakeholders and inter/intra team communications.
Execute operational service level agreements/objectives (SLA/SLO) by partnering with data centers, data center software (DCSW) teams, supply chain, logistics, operational decision support (ODS) and fleet deployment and planning organizations.

title: Technical Program Manager, Crisis Response
minimum_qual:
Bachelor's degree Computer Science or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in program or project management.
preferred_qual:
Experience in managing cross-functional stakeholders.
Familiarity with software development life-cycle and coding.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
responsibilities:
Work with cross-functional stakeholders to formalize cross-team processes for triaging, initiating response and expanding response coverage to new event types. Collaborate with Marketing and Policy teams to ensure users are aware of our response efforts.
Help ensure playbooks remain up-to-date and are sufficiently lightweight.
Be a representative of the Crisis program team and of affected users for other teams (e.g., getting features prioritized, getting buy-in for improved process, etc.).
Monitor and maintain crisis response mailing lists, ensure incoming requests to respond are triaged and those requesting information have their queries resolved.
Lead Google’s responses to natural and human-made crises, triaging of the event and putting the response in motion.

title: Director, Product Management, Ads Integrity

Define the strategy for developers accessing online technical content on Google Cloud and lead the team to deliver on the strategy.
Lead, mentor and grow a global team of passionate technical writers and documentation managers.
Drive measurement, analysis and insight on the effectiveness of content to shape the technology roadmap and resource planning.
Partner across product, engineering and developer marketing to evolve our technical documentation and content strategy.

title: Interaction Designer, Waze
minimum_qual:
Bachelor's degree in Design (interaction, graphic, visual communications, product, industrial, etc.), Human-Computer Interaction, Computer Science, related field or equivalent practical experience.
Experience with web apps and systems/products.
Experience with usable digital interfaces.
Ability to travel internationally as required.
preferred_qual:
Experience working with web or mobile-based technologies such as HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Android Studio, etc.
Experience in designing usable web-based interfaces.
Demonstrated visual design abilities as they relate to applying a brand to digital experiences.
Ability to understand complex products.
Excellent leadership, communication and collaboration skills.
responsibilities:
Define and design user experience for new and existing features in the Waze Map Editor.
Develop high-level detailed mocks and prototypes.
Communicate interaction and design ideas to Product Managers, Engineers, Designers and other stakeholders throughout Waze.
Gauge the usability of new and existing features and make constructive suggestions for change.
Develop knowledge of the highly-engaged community. Communicate with users, get their feedback and listen to their needs while still considering UX.

title: Interaction Designer
minimum_qual:
Bachelor's degree in Design, Human-Computer Interaction (HCI), Computer Science (CS) or equivalent practical experience.
Industry experience in a related field
preferred_qual:
Master's degree in Design, HCI, CS or equivalent practical experience.
Experience working with web or mobile based technologies such as HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Android Studio, XCode, etc.
Demonstrated experience in crafting usable digital interfaces.
Demonstrated visual design sensibilities as they relate to applying a brand to digital experiences.
Excellent leadership, communication and collaboration skills.
responsibilities:
Help to define the user model and user interface for Google products and features.
Develop high level and/or detailed storyboards, mockups, and prototypes to effectively communicate interaction and design ideas.
Gauge the usability of new and existing products and making constructive suggestions for change.

title: Cloud Consultant, Professional Services, Google Cloud (English, Italian)
location: Milan, Metropolitan City of Milan, Italy
minimum_qual:
Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in architecting, developing and/or maintaining solutions in cloud environments such as Google Cloud Platform.
Experience in an account management, client service and/or management consulting role.
Ability to speak and write English and Italian fluently and idiomatically
preferred_qual:
Experience reading software code in one or more language such as Java, JavaScript, Python, etc.
Experience working with channel partners, systems integrators and third-party developers to deliver effective solutions.
Ability to work in a cross-functional and geographically dispersed team and within an evolving and ambiguous work environment.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including presentation writing and delivery.
responsibilities:
Collaborate with Sales/Partner leads and technical stakeholders to translate complex customer requirements into recommendations for appropriate solution architectures.
Work with Customer Technical leads, client executives and partners to manage and deliver successful migrations to cloud solutions.
Create programs and template solutions to achieve scalable impact across the customer and partner ecosystem.
Understand customer needs to help shape Google’s long-term product strategy.
Travel internationally up to 30% of the time to clients and customer's locations.

title: Sales Engineer, Google Cloud Platform (Government)
minimum_qual:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, related technical field or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of experience as technical sales engineer in a cloud computing environment or equivalent experience in a customer facing role (including working as a member of a professional services or systems engineering team).
preferred_qual:
Master's degree in Computer Science or other technical field.
Experience in, and understanding of, data and information management, especially as it relates to Big Data trends and issues within businesses. Hands-on experience using and/or managing databases. Know your way around Map Reduce, Hadoop, Spark, Flume, Hive, Impala, Spark SQL, BigQuery.
Experience with Big Data, PaaS, and IaaS technologies. Experience architecting and developing software for scalable, distributed systems.
Working knowledge of Linux, Web 2.0 development platforms, solutions, and related technologies (HTTP, Basic/NTLM, sessions, XML/XSLT/XHTML/HTML), understanding of DNS, TCP, Firewalls, Proxy Servers, DMZ, Load Balancing, VPN, VPC).
Web application development and integration. Software development platforms and solutions to include J2EE, Java servlets, JavaScript, Python, Go, PHP, ASP, CGI, AJAX.
In-depth knowledge of web, XML, and any related technologies and security standards (HTTP, JavaScript, XML, LDAP, SMTP, etc.)
responsibilities:
Use your technical expertise to help clients determine if Google Cloud Platform is right for them.
Work with the business team to identify and qualify platform opportunities through a formal process. Conduct full technical discovery, identifying pain points, business and technical requirements, “as is” and “to be” scenarios. Architect client solutions to meet gathered requirements.
Take full responsibility for the technical aspects of the business cycle including general teaching, introductory meetings, supporting agreement responses, product and solution briefings, proof-of-concept work, and the coordination of additional supporting technical resources. Identify and handle key customer technical objections, guiding them to success.
Prepare and deliver product messaging in an effort to highlight Google Cloud Platform value proposition and unique differentiators, using white-boarding, slide presentations, product demonstrations, white papers, trial management and request for information (RFI) response documents.
Work hands-on with Google Cloud Platform products to demonstrate and prototype integrations in customer/partner environments. Make recommendations on integration strategies, enterprise architectures, platforms and application infrastructure required to successfully implement a complete solution, providing “best practice” advice to customers to optimize Google Cloud Platform effectiveness.

title: SAP Regional Lead, Global Alliances
minimum_qual:
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
15 years of professional experience; working with complex organizations and customers.
preferred_qual:
15 years of professional experience in product and business roles.
Knowledge of the SAP business application software space, with a vision for the role of cloud within the ecosystem.
Understanding of SAP’s business processes and organizational goals, and established relationships with SAP’s key executives and personnel.
Demonstrated ability to form working relationships across technical and business functions in multiple companies.
Customer engagement experience, complete with a track record of growing business/product revenue.
Demonstrated analytical, communication, collaboration, and problem-solving skills.
responsibilities:
Lead accountability for all facets of the Google Cloud - SAP alliance in the region.
Lead the rollout of offerings in region and ensuring tight collaboration and engagement with the Field Sales teams.
Develop strong relationships with SAP counterparts and engage in joint account planning for HEC opportunities. Create offerings (co-innovating) with Global Strategic Partners in collaboration with local partner sales teams.
Lead strategy for demand generation activities together with marketing, support events with SAP and partners, and drive engagement with local industry Analysts.
Lead a cross-functional SAP Alliance team on agreed upon initiatives. Be the advocate for the SAP Alliance within Google Cloud in region.

title: Manager, Real Estate and Workplace Services Enterprise Platforms
minimum_qual:
Bachelor's degree in Business or Technology, or equivalent practical experience.
7 years of experience with enterprise platforms, including managing integrated workplace management systems (IWMS) implementations/engagements from evaluation and planning through design, development, deployment, and maintenance.
People management experience in leading functional and technical teams in the design and implementation of technology solutions.
preferred_qual:
Experience with information technologies and platforms, including ERP, cloud software services, and CRM.
Experience in technology strategy development, including business case development and crafting implementation roadmaps.
Experience working with onshore and offshore development teams to deliver and operate high-quality business support systems to global client groups.
Excellent interpersonal skills, with a track record of building productive cross-functional relationships and teaching/mentoring others.
responsibilities:
Execute business application architecture review, design, and development for REWS’ IWMS suite, and drive the strategy and roadmap for overall systems architecture to support priority business needs.
Manage a team responsible for gathering functional requirements with diverse user groups, prioritizing needs across those groups, delivering system functionality to the users, and guiding users through the transition to using these systems.
Balance the functionality of the system with the business goals for maximum effectiveness and best business outcomes.
Develop platform strategies beyond IWMS, and bring them to fruition via partnerships with third party technology providers and/or internal engineering groups.
Establish cross-functional relationships with clients, Engineering teams, and leadership to build both team effectiveness and long-term system usefulness. Coach and develop team members, participate in manager-level planning, and foster organizational collaboration for team coherence and success.

title: Technical Solutions Consultant, gTech, University Graduate, 2019 Start
minimum_qual:
BS degree in Computer Science or related software engineering field.
Experience working with client-side web technologies: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and/or HTTP protocols.
Software development experience with one or more general purpose programming languages, including but not limited to: Java, C++, or Python.
Ability to travel as required to meet with specific partner and client stakeholders (varies by specific team).
preferred_qual:
Experience communicating product and technical concepts to technical and non-technical audiences.
Problem solving, analytical, and troubleshooting skills.
Demonstrated knowledge of SQL/MySQL or Unix/Linux operating systems and commands.
Ability to facilitate development and communication of solutions to technical and business stakeholders, with effective listening, critical thinking and problem solving skills.
Ability to collaborate, build consensus, deliver, and drive technical decisions with various sized customer stakeholder groups.
responsibilities:
Analyze and resolve complex technical problems and roadblocks around data and tools.
Identify opportunities to optimize and automate workflows.
Work closely with Product Managers and Software Engineers to improve Google’s tools and products.
Collaborate with gTech, Consumer, and Engineering teams to write code and implement tools to improve troubleshooting efficiency and the end user experience.
Collaborate and communicate effectively with others as well as manage stakeholder expectations in order to solve technical problems and provide technical guidance.

title: Quantitative User Experience Researcher
minimum_qual:
BA/BS degree in Computer Science, Human-Computer Interaction, Statistics, Psychology or a related field, or equivalent practical experience.
2 years of experience in an applied research setting.
Experience in a programming language commonly used for data manipulation and computational statistics (such as Python, R, Matlab, C++, Java or Go), and with SQL.
preferred_qual:
MS or PhD degree in Computer Science, Human-Computer Interaction, Psychology, Statistics or a related field.
5 years of relevant work experience with User Experience or Human-Computer Interaction teams.
Demonstrated expertise in multivariate statistics and the design of experiments.
Proficiency in programming computational and statistical algorithms for large data sets.
Excellent command of research questions within a given domain, and of technical tools for the analysis of data within that field.
responsibilities:
Define and measure quantitative UX goals and metrics in collaboration with Designers, Qualitative Researchers, Engineers and Program Managers.
Examine existing data and product designs to generate hypotheses and plans for high-impact research.
Prioritize and drive research to improve user experience.
Develop code and statistical models to understand user experience.
Drive change by communicating findings to stakeholders in the company. Make research findings convincing and actionable for both research experts and non-experts.

title: User Experience Researcher
minimum_qual:
BA/BS degree in Anthropology, Human Factors, Psychology, HCI/Computer Science or other related fields or equivalent practical experience.
4 years of work experience.
Experience conducting semi-structured interviews, contextual field visits, usability studies either live or remote (e.g. Userzoom or usertesting.com).
preferred_qual:
Master's degree or PhD in a related field.
Experience integrating user research into product designs and design practices.
Experience in survey design (e.g. Qualtrics). Working knowledge of statistics and experimental design.
Strong understanding of the strengths and shortcomings of different research methods, including when and how to apply them during the product development process.
Experience with internet search, advertising, and curation. Love of mobile, apps or development environments.
Effective interpersonal, communication, negotiation and collaboration skills.
responsibilities:
Conduct independent research on multiple aspects of products and experiences.
Collect and analyze user behavior through lab studies, field visits, ethnography, surveys, benchmark studies, server logs and online experiments (A/B testing).
Work with Designers, Product Managers, Engineers and other UXRs to prioritize research opportunities in a fast-paced, rapidly changing environment.
Understand and incorporate complex technical and business requirements into research.
Advocate research findings to diverse audiences through written reports and in-person presentations.

title: Sales Engineer, Security and Compliance, Google Cloud
minimum_qual:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, related technical field, Law or Public Policy or equivalent practical experience.

title: Sales Engineer, Big Data, Google Cloud Platform
minimum_qual:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, related technical field or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in data and information management as it relates to Big Data.
Experience using and/or managing databases.
Experience with one more of the following: Map Reduce, Hadoop, Spark, Flume, Hive, Impala, SparkSQL, BigQuery.
preferred_qual:
Master's degree in Computer Science or other technical field and experience with Big Data, PaaS, and IaaS technologies.
Experience architecting and developing software for scalable, distributed systems.
Web application development and integration experience. Software development platforms and solutions experience in J2EE, Java servlets, JavaScript, Python, Go, PHP, ASP, CGI or Ajax.
Working knowledge of Linux, Web 2.0 development platforms, solutions, and related technologies (HTTP, Basic/NTLM, sessions, XML/XSLT/XHTML/HTML), understanding of DNS, TCP, Firewalls, Proxy Servers, DMZ, Load Balancing, VPN, VPC).
Ability to quickly learn, understand and work with new emerging technologies, methodologies and solutions in the cloud/IT technology space.
responsibilities:
Work to identify and qualify platform opportunities and determine if Google Cloud Platform is right for clients. Identify business and technical requirements, conduct full technical discovery and architect client solutions to meet gathered requirements.
Take responsibility for the technical aspects of the business cycle including such activities as advocating technology, supporting bid responses, product and solution briefings, proof-of-concept work and the coordination of supporting technical resources.
Work hands-on with Google for Work Cloud Platform products to demonstrate and prototype integrations in customer/partner environments.
Prepare and deliver product messaging in an effort to highlight Google Cloud Platform value proposition using techniques such as whiteboard and slide presentations, product demonstrations, white papers, trial management and RFI (Request for Information) response documents.
Make recommendations on integration strategies, enterprise architectures, platforms and application infrastructure required to successfully implement a complete solution providing best-practice advice to customers to optimize Google Cloud Platform effectiveness.

title: Regional Schedule Lead, Project Controls Group, Data Centers
minimum_qual:
BA/BS degree in Construction Management, Quantity Surveying, Engineering or other technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of experience managing multinational technical programs/projects in a mission critical environment
Experience working with owners or general contractors in scheduling/planning positions with various regional construction methods, practices and standards.
Experience in applying lean manufacturing practices in construction projects.
preferred_qual:
MBA or Master's degree with a technical emphasis.
Experience with capital and capacity planning, launching internet software/services, planning data center infrastructure, and/or managing large scale distributed systems.
Experience in implementing lean and project production management methods.
Ability to collaborate and influence across multiple levels of an organization, with experience leading cross-functional process improvements and holding project leads accountable to the greater project goals.
Demonstrated analytical skills with high attention to detail and tenacious problem solver with effective verbal/written communication and facilitation skills.
Comfortability shifting between hands-on detailed analysis and big picture thinking and customizing communication based on the audience.
responsibilities:
Engage with Google’s Data centers partner teams and Engineering groups to understand resource needs and create plans related to delivery and management; includes compute infrastructure, networking and data center infrastructure.
Implement standard procedures for schedule management including baselining, statusing, progress measurement, schedule quality analysis, change management, monte carlo simulation, contingency management, etc.
Manage a variety of scheduling and planning functions encompassing conceptual schedules, options analysis, baselines, progress measurement, schedule analysis at the project level and across the portfolio to identify trends, opportunities and risks using Primavera P6, and reporting with limited supervision.
Support Data Center Project Managers with their projects work package planning, change order review, stakeholder coordination, end to end schedules, review and approval of proposals, pay applications, risk management and value management.
Plan next generation planning processes and platforms/tools to scale with Google’s growth.

Experience serving in the capacity of a technical sales engineer in a cloud computing environment or equivalent experience in a customer- and/or partner-facing role (including working as a member of a professional services, solutions architect or systems engineering team).
Ability to speak and write in English and Japanese fluently and idiomatically.
Ability to travel up to 40% of the time to visit partners across a defined geographic territory
preferred_qual:
Experience in and understanding of data and information management - especially as it relates to big data trends and issues within businesses; hands-on experience using and/or managing databases.
Experience with software lifecycle and build tools as well as past experience architecting and developing software for scalable, distributed systems.
Strong knowledge of Big Data, PaaS, SaaS, IaaS, public cloud, and related industry and technical concepts, as well as working knowledge of web application development platforms and related technologies, strong grasp of enterprise networking and identity management systems, hands-on experience with Linux.
Ability to craft a compelling message and tailor it for a given audience. Ability to mix deep technical expertise with simple, everyday language to deliver a story that is memorable and useful.
Ability to quickly learn, understand, and work with new emerging technologies, methodologies, and solutions in the cloud technology space.
responsibilities:
Work with Partner Managers to identify and recruit the best partners in the market that can deliver innovative solutions to our customers, built on top of Google Cloud (Google Cloud Platform and G Suite).
Develop our partners’ technical teams with both sales and technical competencies, so that they can be successful in the market.
Keep partners up-to-date with product and technical knowledge and competitive differentiators.
Engage with and work hands-on with partner technical representatives in opportunities and projects, complementing their skill and guaranteeing high quality customer deliverables. Advise on integration strategies, enterprise architectures, platforms and application infrastructure required to successfully implement a complete solution providing “best practice” advice to customers and partners to optimize Google Cloud effectiveness.
Be a technical advocate within Google for our partners to help provide feedback from the field.

title: Engineering Manager
minimum_qual:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related technical field or equivalent practical experience.
3 years of hands-on technical leadership and people management experience.
Hands-on programming experience in one of the following: Java, C++ or Python.
preferred_qual:
Master's or Doctorate's degree in computer science or closely related field.
12 years relevant hands-on technical management experience of 8 or more software developers, systems administrator or architects with a record of individual technical achievement.
10 years of relevant industry experience.
Large scale systems design experience.
responsibilities:
Manage a team of software engineers, including task planning and code reviews.
Drive technical projects and provide leadership in an innovative and fast-paced environment.
Be responsible for the overall planning, execution, and success of complex technical projects.
Contribute technically to projects.
Work closely with product management team to ensure that we're building the best products.

title: UX Writer
minimum_qual:
BA/BS degree in Communications, English or Journalism, or equivalent practical experience.
8 years of experience as a UX writer, tech writer, content strategist, or similar.
preferred_qual:
Experience writing for enterprise products.
Experience working with user research and analyzing customer feedback.
Passion for user experiences.
Ability to set priorities and drive work independently to find the right balance between process and flexibility.
Ability to work closely with Design and Engineering teams to turn complex ideas into simple, customer focused messaging.
Effective communication and organization skills.
responsibilities:
Use the Google Ads voice to write precise, accurate and helpful customer-focused copy, including primary feature flows, notifications, error messages and tool tips.
Get requirements from and buy-in on copy from Marketing, Legal, Privacy, Product, Localization and Design teams.
Create clear, easy to follow copy specs that serve as a source of truth for Design, Engineering and other stakeholders.
Collaborate in shaping the process and role of the UX Writer team.

minimum_qual:
Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in a technical sales engineering role within a cloud computing environment or equivalent experience in a customer-facing role.
Experience in networking, including Linux, software-defined networking, network virtualization, open protocols, application acceleration and load balancing, DNS, virtual private networks and their application in PaaS and IaaS technologies.
Ability to travel as required.
preferred_qual:
Master's degree in computer science or other technical field.
Experience creating and developing software or infrastructure for distributed systems.
Knowledge of service provider and data center routing.
Ability to learn, understand, and work with new emerging technologies, methodologies and solutions in the cloud technology space.
Ability to deliver a technical pitch.
Excellent presentation skills.

Share networking experience to support the technical relationship with customers, including product and solution briefings, proof-of-concept work, and partner directly with product management to prioritize solutions impacting customer adoption of Google Cloud.
Work hands-on with customers to demonstrate and prototype Google Cloud product integrations in customer/partner environments.
Recommend integration strategies, enterprise architectures, platforms and application infrastructure required to successfully implement a complete solution using best practices on Google Cloud.
Travel to customer sites, conferences and other related events.

15 years of experience dealing with organizations and customers.

Lead strategy for demand generation activities together with marketing, support events with SAP and partners, and drive engagement with local industry analysts.

title: Privacy Engineer
minimum_qual:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a similar technical field or equivalent practical experience
3 years of experience in a related role and experience with concepts and practices such as threat modeling, data anonymization and classification, auditing access to data, and review of requests for data access.
preferred_qual:
Code maintenance and review experience in one or more general purpose languages.
Understanding of technical privacy issues (cookie management, encryption), and experience with the software development lifecycle.
Understanding and history of applying research to real world problems.
Patience and negotiation skills with a track record of achieving good user outcomes.
Ability to communicate across disciplines (e.g. engineering, legal, policy).
responsibilities:
Guide engineering teams during product development to ensure that their data collection and usage practices are transparent, protect user privacy, and mitigate risk. Play a critical role in Google’s product design process and launch cycle.
Conduct technical and policy reviews to identify and escalate potential privacy concerns.
Lead and manage proactive development of new privacy features and tools.
Contribute to product/business strategy and public policy and legal initiatives to address and mitigate privacy risks. Conduct outreach to Googlers on Privacy topics.
Respond to privacy incidents, if they occur, including collecting information on scope and root cause as well as managing remediation.

title: UX Writer
minimum_qual:
4 years of relevant experience on user-focused writing, including work in hardware, software, digital agency, documentation or journalism.
Experience shaping content for projects, with a portfolio of UX-focused writing samples and style guidelines.
Portfolio of UX-focused writing samples and style guidelines.
preferred_qual:
Bachelor's degree in English, Journalism, Technical Writing, UX, HCI or equivalent practical experience.
Experience developing information architecture for complex documentation sets or product suits. Experience with localization and accessibility best practices.
Knowledge of online technology and related products, including web and mobile UI and tools.
Familiarity with user experience research principles and practices and how to use data to provide informed user insights.
The ability to lead, collaborate, and influence (with and without formal authority) engineering, design, and product management teams.
Skills as a self-starter who can manage projects in a fast-paced environment and remain focused amidst frequently changing requirements.
responsibilities:
Use writing and editing skills to write UI text that facilitates user navigation, as well onboarding, promos, error messages, instructional materials, and other components of the end-to-end user experience.
Drive vision for product language and content across a product or subject-matter domain, and ensure cohesive product narratives; Document your strategies with guidelines, and establish best practices and strategy principles.
Manage projects from needs assessment to implementation; identify opportunities, establish priorities, secure resources, and manage stakeholders.
Collaborate with designers, researchers, legal, marketing, product managers, and engineers; Influence and adapt to stakeholders and their feedback.
Provide leadership, direction, and mentorship to junior UX writers and educate cross-functional partners on the role of UX writing and content strategy throughout the product development process.

10 years of relevant work experience, including technical management of software developers and system administrators/architects.

Experience working with engineering, sales and marketing teams in cloud computing or related technical fields.
Experience as a software engineer and program/project management; experience as an engineering manager.

Ability to craft a compelling message and tailor it for a given audience. Ability to mix technical acumen with simple, everyday language to deliver a story that is memorable and useful.

minimum_qual:
BA/BS degree in Computer Science or related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
3 years of industry experience.
Experience working in collaboration with Software Engineers on a daily basis.
preferred_qual:
Experience managing cross-functional teams, and cross-team technical projects through evaluation and analysis of data and business needs.
Experience in interacting with senior-level executives
Developed business acumen, written, and oral communication and interpersonal skills.

Manage various programs of work, engage inside and outside teams, set the pace for development, deployment and delivery of networking systems and infrastructure. Work closely with technology partners, enable them to offer their technology and services on Google Cloud Platform.

title: Radio Frequency Desense Simulation Engineer, Pixel
minimum_qual:
Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in Radio Frequency (RF) and Electrical Engineering component characteristics/behavior.
Experience in electromagnetic simulation.
Experience performing RF RX sensitivity tests in a radiated environment.
preferred_qual:
Experience with RF coupling path simulation through CST and/or HFSS.
Experience with RF lab equipment, including spectrum analyzers, oscilloscopes, vector network analyzer, near field scanner, OTA chamber, and signal generator.
Knowledge of electromagnetic and antenna theory inside portable wireless devices, including proper grounding, isolation and desense mitigation techniques.
Ability to perform hands-on disassembly and make experimental modifications to intricate hardware.
responsibilities:
Perform noise source modeling, including identifying radiated noise sources and reconstruction based on near field scans, identifying conducted noise sources based on equivalent circuit model, and root cause analysis of noise generation.
Execute coupling path modeling, including full-wave simulations for detailed phone structure and components between the noise source and the victim. Model correlation using measured network parameters, conduct what-if studies to determine the key factors affecting the coupling, and perform root cause analysis of the coupling mechanism.
Conduct noise interference prediction, combine the noise source model with the coupling path model, simulate the coupled noise to the victim, and complete what-if studies to optimize the overall design.
Develop RF desense simulation methodology.
Work closely with the RF Desense Validation team to provide early design feedback through simulation and late stage root cause through simulation and lab measurements.

title: Data Scientist Technical Lead, Engineering
minimum_qual:
MS degree in a quantitative discipline (e.g., statistics, operations research, bioinformatics, economics, computational biology, computer science, mathematics, physics, electrical engineering, industrial engineering) or equivalent practical experience.

preferred_qual:

8 years of demonstrated leadership and self-direction. Demonstrated willingness to both teach others and learn new techniques, including people management.
Applied experience with machine learning on large datasets.
Experience articulating business questions and using mathematical techniques to arrive at an answer using available data. Experience translating analysis results into business recommendations.

Make business recommendations (e.g. cost-benefit, forecasting, experiment analysis) with effective presentations of findings at multiple levels of stakeholders through visual displays of quantitative information.
Research and develop analysis, forecasting and optimization methods to improve the quality of Google's user facing products; example application areas include ads quality, search quality, end-user behavioral modeling, and live experiments.

title: Customer Relationship Management Tech Lead, YouTube
minimum_qual:
Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of experience in hands-on design and software development using an object-oriented programming language (e.g., C++ or Java).
Experience with Salesforce, SQL and enterprise integrations.
Experience with front-end languages and backend tools for web engineering such as Lightning Experience, JavaScript, HTML5, CSS, APEX, or Visualforce.
preferred_qual:
Master's degree in Computer Science or Electrical Engineering.
5 years of experience in hands-on design and development, using Salesforce API, APEX and Visualforce.
Experience with Software Development and REST/SOAP API Integration knowledge.
Ability to use critical thinking and logic skills to isolate and resolve technical issues in a timely manner.
Superior time management and prioritization skills. Strong ownership of quality in code, client/server communication, user experience/user interface.
Exceptional verbal and written communication skills with the ability to effectively influence and communicate cross-functionally with all levels of management.
responsibilities:
Collaborate with Business and Operations teams to define, evaluate, prioritize, and improve CRM features and functionality.
Articulate design considerations, trade-offs, benefits, and recommendations for system design.
Deliver key new features using Salesforce technology, including workflow, process builder, Lightning Experience, APEX and Visualforce, etc.
Work closely with Engineering and Business Analytics teams to improve data flow.
Collaborate with internal teams to improve Salesforce integrations with internal systems.

title: Sales Strategy and Operations Manager, Small and Medium Business Partners, Google Cloud
minimum_qual:
Bachelor's degree in Finance, Management, Business, Operations, Statistics or equivalent practical experience.
4 years of experience in finance, management consulting, corporate strategy, sales strategy and operations or equivalent project management experience in a technology or media company.
Experience in collaborating with cross-functional teams.
preferred_qual:
MBA degree.
Experience developing complex analytical models using spreadsheet and presentation software to facilitate communication with senior stakeholders.
Experience executing complex strategic and operational initiatives; distinctive problem-solving and project management skills.
Ability to pay attention to detail while managing multiple, simultaneous projects.
Strong business acumen and the ability to successfully navigate and influence strong personalities within a complex business environment.
Exposure to working with online channels, telco, and distribution; strong knowledge of and relationships within the technology industries.
responsibilities:
Partner with Partner Directors and managers to develop the team’s business plan, business insights, process improvement and go-to-market strategy; become Senior Management’s trusted advisor.
Combine qualitative and quantitative insights to shape strategy for the business function, analyze operational metrics to anticipate and mitigate performance issues.
Participate in and help steer global initiatives as appropriate; ensure that they are rolled out effectively to the team.
Help define and implement the new Partner organization.
Drive operational improvements for team; optimize resource allocation across business teams, measure progress against goals, and facilitate management discussions and decisions.

title: Facilities Manager
minimum_qual:
Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of relevant experience with an emphasis on facilities, hospitality, corporate services, event management, property management or equivalent office management experience.
Ability to travel up to 20% of the time.
preferred_qual:
Experience managing a facilities/operations team with basic experience of mechanical systems (HVAC, Lighting and BMS systems).
Familiarity with Google applications. Ability to communicate effectively in written format, oral presentations and proficient in the use of common business software programs.
Ability to handle multiple requests, work in a fast-paced environment and be responsive to customer requests/service issues. Ability to navigate ambiguity in a rapidly changing environment.
Ability to think “outside the box” and bring creative, nonstandard and innovative solutions to the table. Ability to meet deadlines and make sound decisions.
Ability to manipulate data and see beyond the numbers, be strategic and draw business conclusions. Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills.
responsibilities:
Provide a pivotal role in facility service operations throughout the region, including new office builds and expansions, capacity and space planning, and implementation of new processes and procedures. Collaborate with teams to ensure an efficient, productive integration for such things as regional initiative, fiscal responsibilities, data analysis, new program implementation and M&A activities.
Influence the customer, client and other internal organizations. Drive consensus and compromise when needed. Communicate program information and updates to Googlers using various forms of Google tools.
Support a variety of critical business functions. Find innovative ways to streamline and enhance service delivery while keeping an eye on the bottom line.
Partner with outsourced facilities services vendor. Ensure best practices are being created by using and testing Google products while also having general oversight of daily operations of offices in all areas of workplace services.
Collaborate with REWS peers to implement yearly initiatives and programs that will benefit the lives of the Google teams that you support. Work with leadership teams to communicate upcoming initiatives and manage the change to ensure success.

title: Facilities Manager, Real Estate and Workplace Solutions
minimum_qual:
Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
6 years of facilities management experience within the corporate real estate industry.
6 years of experience with an emphasis on facilities, hospitality, corporate services, event management, asset management or equivalent office management experience.
Experience in program and project management.
preferred_qual:
Certified Facilities Manager.
Strategic and operational facilities management and services experience, including knowledge of property management, vendor management, leases, construction terms and practices.
Ability to achieve or exceed financial targets and ensure effective, efficient and economic operation of assigned responsibilities.
Ability to communicate effectively in written format, oral presentations and proficient in the use of common business software programs. Familiarity with Google applications.
Data-driven mindset and ability to put data in context and use it to draw conclusions and make business decisions. Ability to lead our vendor partners.
Demonstrated project management skills across a wide range of disciplines, with a service-minded, customer service focus. Flexible and open to new ways of doing business, with the ability to bring creative, nonstandard and innovative solutions to the table.
responsibilities:
Create, implement and manage operational objectives and processes while remaining adaptable to the constantly changing environment. Collaborate with peers to help drive consistency and best practices. Own building impacts communications to occupants and keep REWS Business Partner teams informed well in advance of planned activities.
Be accountable for the building operations and services. Ensure Google is able to thrive by ensuring a high level of quality within your portfolio oversight. Manage programs and vendors and use data to ensure all of Google’s services are meeting leadership’s expectations.
Drive innovation and ensure that REWS is pushing the boundaries of what is possible, bringing strategic direction to the Facilities team. Set and exceed goals in sustainability, accessibility and other values core to REWS service.
Interact with clients at an operational level to understand business needs, pain points and where Facilities can provide the most value. Balance these needs with constraints, ensuring we’re using Google’s resources responsibly. Develop strategic facilities plans that are informed by business priorities and REWS leadership initiatives.
Oversee an outsourced vendor team and own the relationship as it pertains to Integrated Facilities Management. Gather input from your team and key stakeholders to ensure compliance and user satisfaction. Evaluate status and look to adjust key performance indicators to meet business objectives.

title: Strategy and Operations Lead, gTech
minimum_qual:
Experience in leadership and project management, along with analytical experience, and experience communicating with leaders.
Experience working with cross-functional stakeholders and influencing across organizational boundaries.
Experience making actionable recommendations from analyzing data.
Experience structuring and executing analyses to support strategy.
preferred_qual:
MBA degree.
Proficiency with structuring strategic analysis using spreadsheet software.
Knowledge of Search, Exchange, and Brand Ads space and support ecosystem.
Ability to multitask, prioritize, and manage across multiple, often time-sensitive initiatives paired with an effective project management mindset.
responsibilities:
Work with the Leadership team to drive day-to-day operations, including metrics management and regularly report on performance.
Bring EMEA perspective to global projects and partner with teammates in other regions to support EMEA-specific analyses and/or provide EMEA data perspectives and insights.
Collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders in annual business planning, key organizational metrics and other operationally strategic projects.
Work closely with executive leaders to develop operational business reviews and team all-hands communications.
Identify and drive EMEA-specific analyses and deep-dive projects and partner across teams to execute on recommendations.

title: Analytical Lead, Food, Beverage and Restaurants
minimum_qual:
Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
4 years of experience in media analytics, advertising sales, digital media and marketing, consulting or financial analysis.
preferred_qual:
Experience with using search engine marketing (Google Ads), website analytics platforms (Google Analytics and other measurement suite products) and brand analysis techniques (upper funnel analysis).
Experience with marketing analytics, return on investment/financial modeling and statistical analysis.
Experience with spreadsheet software and presentation applications.
Ability to analyze large datasets and prioritize them to a few actionable insights.
Ability to work closely with clients and advise how to increase business performance.
responsibilities:
Use your knowledge of data analytics and predictive and statistical modeling techniques to develop solutions for client businesses and marketing challenges while also uncovering opportunities. Collaborate with Sales and Sales Operations to innovate and develop scalable solutions cross-industry challenges.
Act as an industry promotor and analyst to surface key industry trends. Consult with clients on opportunities associated with trends and potential business impact.
Advise client partners on methodologies for marketing and media analytics and measurement and attribution. Help customers navigate industry standards and alternatives.
Seek out key decision makers, challenge the status quo and influence decisions. Foster client relationships with others in the organization including marketing/advertising, analytics and corporate strategy.
Partner with internal and external Product, Research, Data and Measurement teams to bring full analytical capabilities to customers.

title: Partner Operations Manager, YouTube (English)
