Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in partner and stakeholder relationship management.
Client-facing experience.
Ability to speak and write in English fluently and idiomatically.
preferred_qual:
Demonstrated record of being proactive, making constructive suggestions and coming up with innovative ways to scale initiatives.
Ability to troubleshoot technical challenges our partners face on the YouTube platform.
Knowledge of SQL and spreadsheet software.
Effective communication and organizational skills.
Ability to speak and write in an additional European language fluently and idiomatically.
responsibilities:
Provide operational support for partners on the YouTube platform, primarily through email communication.
Serve as a consultant to internal, cross-functional stakeholders on the YouTube product. Work with market Partner Managers and Technology Managers on account deep-dives and share insights for partner growth.
Identify key metrics to evaluate data both quantitatively and qualitatively.
Contribute to scaling Partner Operations for YouTube through innovation, efficiency gains, and root cause analysis. Streamline operational workflow by identifying and eliminating bottlenecks.
Oversee vendors and collaborators for day-to-day transactional support.

title: Customer Solutions Engineer
minimum_qual:
BS degree in Computer Science or related field, or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in web technologies such as HTTP, HTML, XML, etc. Experience coding in Java, Python or PHP. Experience with databases and constructing SQL queries.
Experience working in a customer-facing role such as sales engineering, consultancy or related function.
preferred_qual:
Master’s degree in Computer Science or related field, or MBA degree.
Experience with SQL, Linux, and cloud/distributed computing platforms (Hadoop, App Engine, etc.).
Experience in one or more of the following areas: program management or software product development; web analytics, online advertising or data science.
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, managing multiple projects simultaneously.
Ability to analyze and use data in order to provide actionable recommendations.
Excellent communication skills, including the ability to translate complex technical concepts to non-technical and executive audiences.

Propose, design and implement complex, customized, cross-product solutions with clients (from engineers to marketing professionals) in your assigned portfolio. Leverage Google’s cloud infrastructure and big data analytics systems to achieve your goals.
Be responsible for end-to-end implementations and escalations handled by other teams.

title: Global Business Planning and Operations Lead, Google Cloud
minimum_qual:
Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
10 years of work experience.
4 years project of experience in management.
Experience leading teams and managing cross-functional stakeholders
preferred_qual:
MBA, Master's degree or PhD.
Experience building, inspiring and leading diverse and high-performing teams.
Experience in Marketing Operations.
Track record of setting goals, managing complex cross-functional projects and getting things done effectively and efficiently.
Ability and interest to mentor peers and coach teammates.
Excellent communication skills.
responsibilities:
Manage and oversee all global business operations (including executive communications, financial processes, special business operations projects, KPI definition and tracking, internal training programs, etc.).
Lead planning (annual and quarterly) and resource allocation, collaborating with all Cloud Marketing functional and regional teams to translate strategy into operational and tactical activities.
Act as key interlock with Finance and Recruiting to ensure appropriate budget and HC management.
Define and implement budget, headcount and vendor management processes in conjunction with regional operations leads to be used by the entire Cloud Marketing organization.
Identify and lead operational improvement projects to help the Cloud Marketing organization scale, including organizational effectiveness initiatives. Define best practices and create efficient, scalable internal business operations processes.

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or equivalent practical experience.
10 years of relevant work experience.
5 years of experience in software program/project management.
Experience with software development methodologies and working with Engineering, Product, and User Experience teams.

3 years of experience with mobile software, ideally with mobile gaming.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Passion for beautiful user experiences and software development methodologies.
responsibilities:
Work closely with Storefront Experience Engineering/Product/UX leads to align on project plans, priorities, and execution/delivery of high quality store experiences.
Think strategically to plan and anticipate future needs and challenges while operating tactically.
Bridge the product development team with our cross-functional partners in Google Play (i.e., Merchandising, Business Development, Operations, Support). Demonstrate excellent communication skills.
Manage multiple interdependent projects of moderate to high complexity and scope.
Use technical judgment to drive project delivery, technology reviews, challenge proposals, and build consensus.

title: Customer Engineering Manager, Google Cloud
minimum_qual:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, a related technical field or equivalent practical experience.
Experience as a technical field engineer in a cloud computing environment or equivalent experience in a similar customer facing role.
Ability to travel up to 50% of the time.
preferred_qual:
Experience as a customer-facing field engineer.
Experience leading a team to achieve business growth goals. Experience with Linux.
Experience with software lifecycle, build tools and architecting and developing software for scalable, distributed systems.
Experience in and understanding of data and information management as it relates to big data trends and issues within businesses. Experience using and/or managing databases.
Knowledge of Big Data, PaaS, SaaS, IaaS, public cloud, and related industry and technical concepts. Knowledge of web application development platforms and related technologies.
Ability to craft a compelling message and tailor it for a given audience. Ability to mix deep technical expertise with simple, everyday language to deliver a story that is memorable and useful.
responsibilities:
Collaborate with Sales Engineering to determine proper staffing levels to support annualized business goals, establish job requisitions, assemble candidate pool and lead interview team to fill open positions.
Organize, train and equip the Sales Engineering team. Assess team’s go-to-market readiness, identify gaps in preparedness and build plans to ensure the team is properly trained and equipped to successfully perform in support of annualized business goals.
Work with Google Cloud Sales leadership to identify, qualify and prioritize coverage for opportunities. Participate in periodic opportunity review meetings providing insight into how to best secure the technical opportunity.
Work with the Sales Account team, customer support, product management, customer solutions and engineering to resolve product problems affecting customer satisfaction.

title: Engineering Manager, Site Reliability Engineering
minimum_qual:
BA/BS degree in Computer Science or related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in one or more of C, C++, Java, Go or Python.
Experience with Unix/Linux systems with scripting experience in Shell, Perl or Python.
preferred_qual:
Hands-on technical experience.
Capable of technical deep-dives into code, networking, operating systems and storage, yet verbally and cognitively agile enough to hold your own in a strategy discussion with Google's executive team.
Proficiency in algorithms, data structures, complexity analysis and software design and/or expertise in Unix/Linux systems, IP networking, performance and application issues.
Demonstrated expertise in recruiting and managing a team of enthusiastic, experienced engineers on large scale projects.
Expertise in problem solving and analyzing global scale distributed systems.
Effective management and communication skills.
responsibilities:
Lead a team or teams of software and systems engineers on projects used and enjoyed by billions of users worldwide and be directly responsible for Google's stellar uptime record.
Manage end-to-end availability and performance of mission critical services and build automation to prevent problem recurrence. Eventually automate response to all non-exceptional service conditions.
Lead by example, care for your team, and establish credibility with the quality of your own and your team's technical execution.
Manage on-call rotations across continents, using a follow-the-sun model.
Design, write and deliver software to improve the availability, scalability, latency, and efficiency of Google's services.

minimum_qual:

Research and develop analysis, forecasting and optimization methods to improve the quality of Google's user facing products; example application areas include ads quality, search quality, end-user behavioral modeling, and live experiments.
Manage a data science team. Interact cross-functionally with a wide variety of leaders and teams, and work closely with Engineers and Product Managers to identify opportunities for design and to assess improvements for Google products.

Collaborate with other marketing, product management, partnerships, sales and engineering functions to define and deliver technology value propositions, marketing narratives and core marketing content.
Drive awareness of our healthcare specific products in the marketplace. Identify opportunities to partner and integrate healthcare-specific products with core Google Cloud Platform products.
Design innovative marketing campaign strategies and partner with product and engineering to develop and/or deliver product demonstrations for major events, including executive keynotes.
Manage and provide regular reporting on marketing key performance indicators and metrics.

title: Product Marketing Manager, Google Cloud Healthcare
minimum_qual:
Bachelor's degree in Business, Marketing, Engineering or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of technology or software marketing experience.
Experience building sales collateral, creative assets and other marketing content, as well as experience presenting and delivering strategic and technical presentations.
Experience working with clinical data, biomedical research, telehealth, digital health, or healthcare data management technologies.
preferred_qual:
MBA degree or Master's degree in Engineering.
Experience planning and executing marketing programs.
Experience launching products and building global scale campaigns.
Experience working as a product advocate or technology advocate.
Track record of working collaboratively across multiple Engineering, Product Management and Marketing teams.
responsibilities:
Define, prioritize and land the go-to-market strategy for multiple healthcare products.
Collaborate with other marketing, product management, partnerships, sales and engineering functions to define and deliver technology value propositions, marketing narratives and core marketing content.

Design innovative marketing campaign strategies and partner with product and engineering to develop and/or deliver product demonstrations for major events, including executive keynotes.

title: Policy Enforcement Manager Lead, YouTube Trust and Safety
minimum_qual:
Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of experience in content policy, anti-abuse or scaled operations.
Relevant consulting or program management experience.
Experience managing teams.
preferred_qual:
2 years of experience identifying abuse trends or working in news or policy with passion for international issues, including freedom of expression, online controversial content, cyber crime, etc.
Strong analytical skills, including using data to drive strategy and business action; experience with SQL, programing and spreadsheets.
Comfortable working with different tools and software.
Strong business judgment and outstanding influencing and communication skills; ability to build strong relationships with cross-functional partners.
responsibilities:
Lead a team of Policy Enforcement Managers including coaching, team prioritization and problem solving.
Stay up to date on key trends and suspicious patterns, including deceptive online practices. Review controversial, and sometimes offensive video content in line with YouTube’s Community Guidelines.
Manage escalations with a fast turn-around time to define and deliver the best action plan.
Be passionate about working cross-functionally, thinking strategically, and keeping our users safe while protecting free speech.
Be available on-call as required on weekends on a rotational basis to handle policy escalations, which require immediate resolution, from both internal and external stakeholders.

title: Treasury Analyst
minimum_qual:
Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of experience in a corporate treasury or other finance operations team.
Experience in defining and documenting business requirements and processes.
preferred_qual:
Experience in global Treasury Operations function.
Working knowledge of spreadsheet software, SQL, Google Apps Script and VBA.
Excellent business acumen and ability to facilitate discussions with senior executives to obtain key decisions.
Exceptional analytical and communication skills.
responsibilities:
Support the development of business requirements for product launches and other projects.
Complete ad-hoc compliance requests such as regulatory audits and bank/license requirements for all payment entities.
Track and monitor changing payments regulations that impact Google’s billing system and facilitate bank support.
Design legal entity and cash flow structure to optimally meet business needs, reduce Treasury risk and increase efficiency.

title: Energy Business Development Manager, Google Hardware
minimum_qual:
Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in sales, business development, or partner management.
preferred_qual:
Experience in managing long sales cycles with a focus on the energies and utilities sector.
Demonstrated track record of working towards strategic business goals.
Ability to plan and manage both at strategic and operational level.
Ability to manage ambiguity, solve problems, and scale effectively across a large organization.
Ability to speak and write in English, Dutch, German, French and/or Spanish fluently and idiomatically.
responsibilities:
Initiate, develop, and manage lasting relationships with energy providers in Europe.
Lead C-level meetings as with working at program level to ensure account success.
Engage with regulators and other key stakeholders to foster support and framework for smart home products.
Work cross-functionally within the organization to bring the best of Google to energy partners.
Travel up to 40% of your team will be meeting current and potential partners.

title: UX Design Manager
minimum_qual:
12 years of experience in UX Design.
3 years of experience managing or leading design teams.
Portfolio of UX-focused work samples for web and mobile applications.
preferred_qual:
Effectiveness in working across organizational boundaries to define, manage, and prioritize work.
Excellent communication, presentation, interpersonal, and analytical skills; the ability to communicate complex interaction concepts clearly and persuasively across different audiences and varying levels of the organization.
responsibilities:
Provide leadership, direction, and mentorship for a team of UX Designers; lead creative and holistic thinking across diverse product releases, platforms, and devices.
Deliver a UX vision, along with a plan for evolutionary, iterative updates, that actualize the larger vision over time.
Build strong relationships and operating rhythms with leaders inside and outside their core product team to efficiently implement user experiences that are cohesive, inclusive, and well-informed.
Foster Google’s culture and principles within the group, while setting new standards in executional and operational excellence.
Be responsible for and effectively advocate for users in a fast-paced, corporate climate, imparting day-to-day design leadership that fosters a shared understanding of the user-centric intersection between design, content, business, and engineering.

title: Data Scientist, PhD University Graduate
minimum_qual:
PhD degree in a quantitative discipline (e.g. statistics, bioinformatics, computational biology, computer science, applied mathematics, or similar) or equivalent practical experience.
Relevant internship or work experience with data analysis.
Experience with statistical software (R, S-Plus, SAS, or similar).
Experience with databases and scripting languages (such as Python).
preferred_qual:
Authorization to legally work in the United States.
1 year of relevant work experience (i.e., data scientist role), including deep expertise and experience with statistical data analysis such as linear models, multivariate analysis, stochastic models, sampling methods.
Ability to draw conclusions from data and recommend actions.
Demonstrated leadership and self-direction. Demonstrated willingness to both teach others and learn new techniques.
responsibilities:
Work with large, complex data sets. Solve difficult, non-routine analysis problems, applying advanced analytical methods as needed; Conduct end-to-end analysis that includes data gathering and requirements specification, processing, analysis, ongoing deliverables and presentations.
Build and prototype analysis pipelines iteratively to provide insights at scale. Develop comprehensive understanding of Google data structures and metrics, advocating for changes where needed for both products development and sales activity.
Interact cross-functionally with a wide variety of people and teams. Work closely with engineers to identify opportunities, design and assess improvements to Google products.
Make business recommendations (e.g. cost-benefit, forecasting, experiment analysis) with effective presentations of findings at multiple levels of stakeholders through visual displays of quantitative information.
Research and develop analysis, forecasting and optimization methods to improve the quality of Google's user facing products; example application areas include ads quality, search quality, end-user behavioral modeling and live experiments.

title: Google AI Resident (Healthcare), 2019 Start (Fixed-Term Employee)
minimum_qual:
A clinical degree (e.g., MD, RN, PharmD, etc.) or a healthcare-specific research-focused doctoral degree (e.g., PhD in Biostatistics, Epidemiology, or a related field).
Experience with quantitative research in healthcare, including peer-reviewed publications.
Experience with one or more programming languages.
Ability to participate for one full year on site.
preferred_qual:
Experience with machine learning approaches in healthcare data (e.g., publications, or links to open-source work or novel learning algorithms).
Expertise with research using complex healthcare data, for example, but not limited to: medical imaging, electronic health record or genomics data.
Contributions to machine learning research communities and/or efforts, including publishing papers in machine learning venues (e.g., JMLR, ICLR, NIPS, ICML, ACL and CVPR).
responsibilities:
Learn and understand research in deep learning and/or machine learning algorithms.
Partner with research mentors to formulate research project(s) and/or novel application(s) of machine learning.
Conduct research and publish it in competitive venues.
Implement algorithms in TensorFlow.

title: Global Supply Chain and Sourcing Manager, ASIC, Outsourced Assembly and Test, Consumer Hardware
minimum_qual:
5 years of experience in process integration, technology management, or product engineering in a fabless IC/OSAT environment.
Experience in the semiconductor industry and suppliers landscape.
Experience working and partnering with supplier management at a global scale.
Experience collaborating and working cross-functionally with Finance, Legal, Engineering and Operations/Manufacturing teams.
preferred_qual:
MBA, Master's degree, or PhD in a related Engineering field.
3 years of experience in OSAT sourcing, sales, and/or supplier management.
Experience in independent contractor (IC) modeling and trends.
Ability to travel as required.
responsibilities:
Develop supplier selection and business agreements with ASIC and OSAT suppliers including pricing, business models, capacity, technology, yield, and related supplier management aspects.
Ensure supply security, on-time delivery, and quality competitiveness with suppliers.
Manage and drive all commercial related discussions such as Request for Information, Proposal, Quote (RFI, RFP, RFQ), and Statements of Work (SOW), License Agreements, and Purchase Agreements.
Enable strategic ASIC suppliers and OSAT selection. Work with Engineering teams to support next generation technology roadmap and analyze key figures of merit on both technology and business aspects.
Define and align on sourcing strategies to support business needs taking into account multiple variables and scenarios on demand and supply, and help execute on sourcing plans. Manage key business metrics, supplier relationships, and supplier business reviews (SBR).

title: Analytics Manager, gTech Users & Products
minimum_qual:
Master's degree in engineering or technical/scientific field of study or equivalent practical experience.
4 years of relevant experience on analytics teams, management consulting team or corporate strategy team for a technology firm.
Experience in one or more programming languages (Python, Java, C++, Ruby, Perl, etc.) and analysis tools (R, Pandas, etc.).
preferred_qual:
Graduate degree from business school with a technical Bachelor's degree or knowledge of technology.
5 years of experience building and managing an analytics team.
3 years of industry experience in a consumer-internet, web analytics, or closely related analytics role. Software, Internet and/or media industry experience.
Experience writing and maintaining ETLs which operate on a variety of structured and unstructured sources.
Data analysis skills in a business context with demonstrated success in presenting large datasets in a clear and compelling manner that inspires action. Basic scripting skills in either Python or R.
Demonstrated ability to work and incorporate feedback from stakeholders. Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
responsibilities:
Grow and lead a team of analysts focused on carrying the users voice for flagship Google products (Apps, Photos, Gmail, Google Fi, etc.). Lead analytically-driven problem-solving to develop actionable business insights and recommendations.
Work closely with gUP Product operation teams to launch new products and generate insights that improve users support outcomes.
Identify and define the right metrics that quantify the success of product support initiatives, users engagement.
Apply your expertise in data analytics and visualization to see beyond the numbers and understand how our users are affected by business initiatives.
Help the team do deep analysis using any and all tools in your toolset including collaborating internally with partner analyst teams (data engineering, research and science, and operation analytics).

title: Account Representative, Search Ads 360 (English, Portuguese)
location: São Paulo, State of São Paulo, Brazil
minimum_qual:
Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
Experience with SEM/SEO.
Experience in online, software sales or online marketing.
Ability to speak and write in English and Portuguese fluently and idiomatically.
preferred_qual:
Experience in the ad tech market and in the use of programmatic Search Engine Marketing (SEM) ad buying tools.
Track record of building effective and lasting customer relationships with an strategic and analytical approach.
Understanding of the underlying technology behind digital advertising.
Ability to handle multiple ad hoc requests simultaneously in a well-organized and analytical manner.
Effective organizational, analytical, influencing, and presentation skills.
responsibilities:
Engage with client and channel partners to understand and assess customer requirements, prepare and present demonstrations of Google’s Search Ads 360 technologies, and address and overcome technical challenges that arise throughout the process.
Lead efforts to drive innovation, working across the organization to identify the right assets and tools to drive customer engagement.
Lead the process of setting new Search Ads 360 customer for success, aligning the technology Google offers with the key performance indicators (KPIs) customers care about, following through to reach those KPIs.
Engage with existing Search Ads 360 customers and provide solutions, integrating their Search efforts with other elements of their Marketing strategy, with the goal of unlocking new opportunities for customers and smarter ad buying.
